hVY5dJtw_B3zdAYN4V7I0A.review_text: A neighborhood bar in a neighborhood were bars are usually overrun by people that aren't neighbors...

KB8Z9UY9qBSMIqNVCl07hg.review_text: I hate to give away my usual hangouts in the City, but since there are a whopping 135 reviews of Tony N's, I guess I'm not giving away much at this point.  For me North Beach is far from tolerable on the weekends, but a great place to hang out weeknights.  Tony Nik's is great for many reasons.  It's small, unassuming, it has a core of regulars, and that really makes you feel like N. Beach is still a real neighborhood.    The bathrooms are SUPER tiny.  Like something you would see on a train or a propeller DC 9 plane.  If you can get there between 4-6pm on a weekday, grab a spot at the bar, keep the vibe friendly, and keep it real.  Oh, and enjoy the cocktails!

GXn4ZsasLKh0qZ5g3nIqcQ.review_text: What a cool bar, it's a shame so many people know about it. If I were omnipotent, I would have this place permanently set with about half a dozen people in it. But I'm not, and it's still really cool, small and cozy with really nice staff, even when I begin slurring my words. We were up here for a friends birthday party and had a great time hanging out and it wasn't so loud that we couldn't talk. You never find that. I can't say anything else that everyone hasn't already said. Good bar with good drinks and good people.

I9evxA7DQQUuOoRF2AWCgg.review_text: This is a great place to have a few drinks while waiting for tables at surrounding restaurants. I had a great time here with my wife, the drinks were cold and the prices were fair.

gwiGnfRc88htvkyIRyCsIQ.review_text:
A nice hidden gem in often noisy North Beach.  The bartender, Danny, was funny, friendly and easy going, just like the place.  Nothing pretentious.  Nice to meet friends for a casual happy hour.  I hope to go back again.  
  And this comes from someone who doesn't frequent bars often.
  Bottom's up!

j8mIPH18DpTF-CdJFHV87A.review_text: if i were a dude, looking to find some clueless girls, this would be a four-star joint for me. if i were a girl, out with a few friends, i'd be scared of the same guys swarming and annoying us. if i were me, i'd find both of those types hilarious and just want to enjoy a beer or two on the back sofa, which i did tonight.  this place is alright. i can sum it up in one, small sentence: "it's north beach." expect cocky meatheads and smarmy princesses to abound.

2ojO4ZImtGy71cMqoKgOQw.review_text: My friends and I decided to get a drink in North Beach before seeing a comedy show at Cobb's.  We wandered a block or so from Washington Square and found this little dive.  It was empty and so we took seats at the bar and had a short conversation with the bartender there.  It's small in there, but it felt nice and neighborhoody unlike a lot of the NB lounge bars.  Ya gotta love stiff drinks and cool barmen.

BHDBfx4mWOdtT-ug0CPc3w.review_text: The bartenders are amazing and generous, the ambiance is lovely, DJ is always rockin it.  Every time I come here, I have a great time. There is plenty of standing room, bar space, and a sitting area in the back. The decor is beautiful. I really just love everything here!

bkT1wsuQkOyOVk0eOFM_8Q.review_text: I love this place!!!!!  I need to stop back in sometime soon.  One of the only non cheesy/ ba nd T places in North Beach.

A9RKvWz-as6hzSKS_xwVrw.review_text: fun neighborhood bar.  somehow i always end up here after dining in the area.  and it's usually after having a few already...so much so that i'd always forget what bar it was the next day.    so this last time,  the bartenders tucked a napkin with their logo on it into my purse.    i was quite thankful since i was missing my amex card the next day.  lo and behold, the napkin was my saving grace and i was quickly on the phone and chatting with one of the friendly bartenders.  apparently this happens often as they had 6 other forgotten cards on hand.  you can find straight up classic drinks but no real fancy mixology here.  overall, it's a nice and unpretentious bar to chill and relax at the counter or at the smaller seated tables in the back.  cheers!

O2WfOgwdSxIl-4UkqY88dA.review_text: Awesome NB neighborhood bar.  I love this place. Its got great retro style, cool non-touristy neighborhood people and a place you can always go and hang if you want a cocktail.  It gets a bit crowded on weekends due to its small size, but I love to hit this place on the weekdays.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: It's funny because this place has a super ghetto sign that looks like it got battered by a hurricane but the inside is quite nice. First cafe I have been to in which neither food nor coffee are its core competency. Pretty small bar with a few tables in the back to sit around. Compared to the other North Beach bars, this place is clean-cut, organized, and more contemporary which makes it a nice stop in between the traditional pubs with all the filth and ruckus.

q49KYrts_SI8nekGHB6Ydw.review_text: Typical long, narrow lounge.  Very loud.  Sort of hot and stifling.  Trying to be something different with parquet wall tiles and sheer curtains covering nothing.  Not good for groups.  Meh.

ZJMrk2BwAkN0Dtc73qtN8g.review_text: Great Neighborhood bar.  Laid back vibe, not at all pretentious, but not it doesn't have the tough guy, greaseball contingent that some other bars in North Beach have.

nYufXwZH9ooB_zjNJf8Xlg.review_text: Been here a couple of times.. the first was during the North Beach festival. That was a goddamned nightmare..long and skinny it doesn't take much to get this place crowded..the second time I came it was during the afternoon and that was a lot more enjoyable. One plus is they take CCs..make it a stop, not a destination and be modest with your expectations and you should be fine..

NN5jldDW0Puf8E3ZZjKqsg.review_text: A grown-up bar in a neighborhood full of teenagers.

qVCGzJCDnjwut1dnHef2Og.review_text: Stopped in here a couple weeks ago after hitting the Park Tavern (old Moose's where I used to work) and realized that has got to be one of my favorite bars in San Francisco.   Devon was there - of course, and she rocks. I just love this place and if you're reading this - go check it out. It's a dynamite bar - lounge type of atmosphere. There never seems to be any 'tool bags' in here. Just good people that are cool to talk too - with awesome bartenders pouring great drinks.   This is a can't miss kind of place.

6IGMJbGve3Fa5FKFyQ5zdg.review_text: This is another place that I cannot believe I haven't written a review of.  I was here last night, and after realizing how long it had been since my last visit, I remembered why I like Tony Nik's so much:  - on weeknights, there is always a place to sit (weekends can be crowded, but that's okay) - you can actually hear your companions talking - the bartenders are super friendly and nice - a lot of the patron's are locals and not skeezy like at some other NB places - the atmosphere of the place gives off a good vibe  I really feel like this place is great for all sorts of occasions, whether it's a drink with coworkers, a place to take a date, or whatever.  I've been here for all sorts of reasons (including New Years a few years ago, as well as a Halloween party) and I always have a fantastic time.

zpswu_OyqtF4ib1ydsCR3Q.review_text: Lets paint the scene...  So it's Thursday night and you are looking forward to meeting a new guy at a local bar. Nervous, and practically sweating you stroll to the closest bar between your two North Beach residents. Walk in to this dark bar which is playing a fabulous assortment of 80' music. Grabbed a couple drinks and went to the back booth to chat. We actually had to bartender bring us our drinks to the table so we never had to leave our conversation.   4 hours, 4 cocktails, and the couple sitting near us completely making out the whole night... priceless. I love this bar.  Lost a star because the bathrooms are tini-tiny.

6b8euAmPhCI-gminQJqWew.review_text: Sebastian is an amazing bartender!! Tell him what you like and he can create something you never knew you needed, but now you can't live without. They serve Pushback wines too, which those who know GET it.

LJEkJfP4FpJp6j4_bAKgOw.review_text: I never liked lemon drops before...UNTIL I CAME TO TONY NIK'S! The lemon drops are about $8, which to me isn't that bad in the city. My friend was the one who is responsible for getting me into this place. We go here every other week as part of our "bi-weekly gossip sessions." The reason why I love it so much is that on Sundays it is very quiet and chill. The ambiance is nice and the bartenders in the evening are really cool. I really believe me and my friend make Dave's shift on Sundays so much brighter! I also had the chance to meet the owners and knowing how nice and friendly they are makes it that much more enjoyable to go there. But be careful when there is a big event in the area when you go here because this bar gets packed fast! Especially during the North Beach Festival! But if you go during non-busy hours and want to chill and have a drink this is the place...and the main reason I gave it 5 stars was because the bartenders play music from their own iPods and Dave plays the greatest old school hip-hop music!

PQPk3yifh1O0C7tYAmGfLg.review_text: +4 for bartenders who're on point and know their whiskeys/bourbons/ryes. Plus their girl-y mixed drinks. Don't hate, just sayin'.  +3 for having a very cool layout and atmosphere - you'll understand once you get there. It's a bar to which you'll look forward to going. Srsly.

2LEkfGtjbiTP7vjzx04Zqg.review_text: Great atmosphere and bartenders. Cocktails are solid, but nothing special.

CWmxyq7xRq6zNGLdQJMoRA.review_text: Loved the dim lighting, loved the bartendress, loved the two topped candle-lit tables. Great for dates or intense conversation partners, not for groups. Cocktails are unique, well presented and smooth. However, you get about 4 oz less of liquid than you might at a similarly tasty establishment for $13.

UebYQUNZyOJ2coa71o_EsA.review_text: My favorite bar in the city for after dinner cocktails.  Old school.  Great service.  Sebastian is a pro

etKKH6F0D9BJan-UPQgQaA.review_text: Stopped in here on a Sunday during the North Beach festival. The place was obviously packed but they actually provided some good and fast service, so we were able to get some drinks without having to wait too long. Just a typical neighborhood joint though and pretty small, but I'm sure i'll stop in again the next time i'm in the area.

2gP8s5dOJmwVKVm0GNMU0w.review_text: good non-divey spot to grab a drink in north beach  Update  Been here on multiple occasions now  Consistently good drinks.. Cucumber gimlets anyone? Also, the bartender found out my love for reading and gave me a book. From his own collection.  It's the little things

6ATfXxQLQuRAQ30-nLI6Yg.review_text: I'm giving this 4 stars, but only because it fits perfectly for it's purpose... not because i'd come here time and time again.  young proffessional? looking for pretty young girls? Enjoy people between the ages of 21-29?  Don't come here.  I describe this as a greaaat old people bar.  The bartenders are chill and laid back, the crowd is very "mature", and the place is small and dingy enough that you keep your expectations low.  I came here with a friend's dad when HE wanted to meet girls;  I'd never come here on the prowl though.  Bring like 2-5 friends if you want a chiller scene with out much distraction... except for drunk older people of course.

Cv84AfkAhU6LAnll0JUaVg.review_text: One of my favorite neighborhood bars. Great selection of booze and bartender Sebastian is the man. Friendly people, good music, and i always seem to run into someone I know. Whenever people ask for a good local northbeach bar to go to, I send them there.

pb1-wJAf-ZGkggABtMq73Q.review_text: My favorite dive in North Beach.  I don't want to admit how long I've been coming to this bar, but its just one of those great neighborhood spots that makes north beach north beach.  Please keep Tony Nik's around another 50 years.

6XCZoufB_S-sY6vsxMGd8Q.review_text: Came here after Joey and Eddie's.  I think I have one sentence that can best describe this bar.  A dive bar that is now a lounge because of its professional servers and renovation 7 years ago.    Will definitely come back.  Service was quick.  Price is reasonable. Very beautiful people here. They even have dice cups here.  Love the old and faded sign outside of the bar but the super modern look inside.

vLfRgjVHw4zSiKOmM7XvqQ.review_text: I'm on a roll with all these great dive bar reviews... perhaps my standards have been compromised?  All-in-all Tony Nik's is probably one of the best followup ideas to a night of standup at Cobb's that I've experienced.  Walking in to TN's was what I remembered the bar area of the Regal Beagle to be like- down to Larry sitting at the bar scamming on chicks.  It's a skinny squeeze past the bar to the little lounge area and the bathroom.  Agree with Lou Eaaaasy with the tiny bathroom.  I dunno, maybe he went to the ladies' restroom too.  Not at the same time as me of course unless I didn't see him but who can hide anything in that little broomcloset?  I digress.  Retro 70's wooden veneer paneled walls, red vinyl stools and tacky, brassy wall decorations.  No gold-veined mirrors in the bathroom though :).  Bartender was on his toes and the bouncer was friendly.

SWDoQRZII76ewKPLhgtzpg.review_text: Ok- I have been in NB for a year now and TNs is still my go-to bar. I have decided to upgrade my rating to 5 stars- because it deserves it - even though my fave bartender did not recognize me on my birthday ;) I can't deny it is my favorite drinking hole. The new HUGE flat screen TV rocks and if and when I decided to follow any sports - I will be sure to watch all the games there. In the meantime I will continue to frequent TNs with reckless abandon!!!!  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ this bar quickly became my neighborhood go-to bar. Nice feel, not a dive, but not too stuffy. You can get a great drink, chat with Sebastian, who is a sweet heart of a bartender and all the while it does not matter if you are in stilettos or a tshirt and jeans. Basically - you can't go wrong.

1xZflgh5eGuKGtg7PlhNRg.review_text: Tony Nik's has become my destination when in North Beach. Beginning with the locals' faces and hugs, the moment you walk into this classy bar with warm hues and comfortably snug seating, you will feel beautiful amongst beautiful people. I wouldn't be regarded as a martini drinker, but I've found myself asking for a 'dirty martini, two olives' a number of times. Why you ask? Who knows. But the nook brings it out of me. Seriously, if  you want a sip of insider NB, then dare to venture inside the bar.

mkZKrVhKkJrGXdKJ1JCALA.review_text: Tony Nik's is the Place!  If you live in "The hood!" This place is Booming with mostly locals! Don't hold it against them if the "riif raff " from Broadway stumbles in!!  You can always count on a friendly bartender~ And a good cocktail!  Devon makes the best margarita's! I always bring my friends from different neighborhoods into Tony's... And they always love it!!!

8Y6h0FDZUBDk_5k4WT1_kg.review_text: I love this place.  Straight up bar, no bullshit.

aExpX6wtMVGcgeW-7rNMaQ.review_text: Sabastian is everything a good bartender should be. Great drinks and took pride in his work. Amazing to see.

B7ecAeAIrXg7sgmabS38pg.review_text: Solid.  As a new to the SF scene and a gal who's still trying to learn about the different neighborhoods, i had pretty much written North Beach off as a tourist trap with Italian food. And while that's true on some levels, there always seems to be a bar that shatters the stereotype and Tony Nik's is it.   From the moment I walked in, I was treated like a local. The bartendress was rockin with her cute pigtails and friendly smile. The "regulars" at the bar were quick to say hello and offer me a seat as they muddled away at a drink and talked about how much they loved their neighborhood and the bar and everyone you looked at was having a great time.  The surrounds were very retro, which I always love and while I wasn't planning on having hard liquor, well, when you are surrounded by a vibe like that and coming off a long and stressful week, there is no shame in having a martini with three olives on the slightly diiiirty birdy side. And they make a good one here. Actually they made 4 good ones here, but hey, who's counting.  Answer: Your liver, stephy!

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: A locals bar if ever there was.

kuRZJ2Xa6JDPVVXdlt6DJA.review_text: Cool bar and even cooler bartenders. The Dark & Stormy here is great.

3TyX5TKtWFCJxWqVKKxIqw.review_text: This lil hole in the wall spot is great.  Our bartender was a bit "douchey" when I noticed a rare bottle of tequila on his shelf, he had a real "this is MY HOOD" attitude.  I laughed and enjoyed my company and the ambiance.  We ordered a few Grey Goose martinis and headed to the back of the bar.  They have a really cool area for seating.  It is just down from the bar which gets busy at times because this isn't a big place.  I love that a bunch of "tourists" don't know about this place, because it has a real local feel and that is what I am going for when I am in from out of town.  One drink was enough to move on to the next stop, but Tony Nik's will definitely be on our list to stop again when we get back to San Fran.

CEzX4YwAGc5rm75ME1vEyw.review_text: Not the 4.5 I thought it would be. $25 min to use a credit card... Oh thanks for mixing my vodka and ginger beer and calling it a mule... Nope, add some lime.. I won't be back. Just not a true 4.5 star.

kmczVTpkOsqgcf5MiRfBYQ.review_text: I deem it Casanova's bar- sexy and chill. Space is small but the rotation seemed to be about hour-long stays.  Great place to get some strong and intricate cocktails and the bartender was extremely nice and eager to find a good blend based on tastes we like and the liquors we enjoy.  Also very welcoming and not intimidating or snotty if you are a genuine novice looking to expand your pallete :)

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: I'm kind of embarrassed that I have only been here once, and live 2 blocks down the street. Well, all that is going to change. Tony Nik's has a nice vibe to it and some comfortable seating. The staff is extremely friendly as well. The Dirty Martini that Sebastian made was pretty damn good...  Update: The go to bar of choice in NB. I took my mom here and she had a good time, so what else can you say...

M7i_ayzVxB0MBZuxFSzdUA.review_text: Rat Pack-ish = refined level of cool. Stiff drinks and laid back atmosphere.

GVeOyQJ1uTKvxNF-9d6eFQ.review_text: This one of my local spots in my neighborhood. Tony Niks makes great drinks alongside the atmosphere of 1960's mod art deco. A great place to go after dinner in north beach. Keep in mind it's pretty small and can get a litle tight. The best thing about this bar is little or NO TOURISTS.

3qmc6RH-qJfAVTYxe3kX8w.review_text: Nothing special. Drinks are reasonably priced but not much kick. There was elevator music playing and a few bare tables in a bare, dark room. I would not come back considering all the lively nearby cafés, pubs, and bars.

eUpfvPufEHIZ2BgpKbupqw.review_text: Worst Moscow Mule ever. No personality. Dry bartender who can't put even the slightest effort into a mule. Oh, and there's a $20 min for credit cards. Love scam joints like this.

Y8j9qHpOz8b26f5gu3Z9Xg.review_text: sebastien remembers what you ordered the last time you were there, even if you haven't been there for a month.  enough said.

GjLTmizj5kfVYU8mxagQVQ.review_text: This is a great place to get a drink on a weeknight when you want to actually hear your companions.  Kudos to the bartender!  It's been awhile since someone made a  Maker's Mark Manhattan, over, the correct way (shaken a couple of times in a cocktail shaker and not stirred in the glass with a straws).  Tip well!

rLWW2l6oXyHrzv3TrbuBHg.review_text: Classic SF bar left over from the good ol days. if you get hungry, Tonys and Don Pistos is right around the corner.

gmT8KUZYLd3WZzvnF2ja6A.review_text: I read some of the reviews here and thought this might be a good place to take a date.  Let's review......  Crappy parking 'round the 'hood, but I'm a nice guy, so the karma gods smirked my way and a spot opened up with the light coming out of the clouds and everything!  Which was weird coz it was like 10PM!  It was my bad though!  Who the hell looks for parking at North Beach!    Walked the two blocks to the place and was kinda freaked out by the look of a run down bar that might have been right at home in the Tenderloin, it was just missing the crack addict that suffices as a heat lamp with his lighter and spoon at the ready.  Maybe he was shoo'd away by the bouncer at the door!  The inside was nice though!  Very retro look of maybe the 50s with decent music coming from the jukebox.  We found a nice cozy table for two with candlelight and everything.  The music was decent and allowed for flirty conversation. Wasn't so sure about the crowd though since I went to get a drink for my date and returned to see one of the bar patrons playing wing-woman for some guy that was lurking in the crowd.  My date was suave though and let her know that she was already on a date, and the wing-woman quickly got out of her face.    The bartender was great!  Good drinks, and speedy service!  All in all, I would have to say 2/5 stars just cause of the look of the place on the outside (one star) and because of the semi-shady crowd (two stars...boo!!).

l7V5w_vf9xv74As3abZukA.review_text: Tony Nik's is a great, classy, cozy, little spot to have a drink on a Sunday evening with mixed company.  If you're looking for "a scene", this is not the place.   You go here to have well-made drinks, chat with the bartender, or have a conversation with a buddy or your date.   If I lived in the 'hood, I would probably be a regular.

KnUIlAcXRvbpNh4-yNVqUw.review_text: Yup, I agree. Really love this place (although weekends are a little crowded.)  Only problem is when we go we drink too much, get hungry and go next door to Mangarosa and spend way too much money.  Plus they have Sailor Jerry rum. Mmmmm.

ZKWWW5JVW-_g_hwDif7sFg.review_text: Hell yeah, five stars! Let me tell you why... because Sebastian knows how to make the best Manhattan ever, and his hair is utterly flawless. The douche bag count is usually pretty low and the vibe is always a nice crowd of toasted locals.

hlRIXK4ju_Y-VMcPfhKu9Q.review_text: Love Love Love this bar!! We had an engagement party here and it was an absolute blast! Tony Nik's staff and management was top notch in making our party easy and completely stress free! We brought in a few things to eat from a great deli a few doors down (La Spiaggia) and let our friends fend for themselves at the bar. The service was friendly and fast, we did a champagne toast for 35 people and had the glasses poured in less than 5 minutes, and they even heated up the arancines we brought and helped pass them out. I can't say enough nice things about the Tony Nik's family and I highly recommend this bar for anyone that wants to have a good time!

krhueH9uihxVjhhDNcqi5g.review_text: Kind of a hole in the wall but much cleaner and classier than the outside depicts. Good drinks and prices... Came here on a Friday night and had quick service and a place to sit, can't beat that!  Liked the 70's music playing in the background.

VpA9rglOpm_vEHtz4tH_KQ.review_text: Tony Nik's is my local. So while I am willing to admit to spending far too much time there (which shows my lack of creativity) I feel that I am greatly suited to write said review.  Whether or not you enjoy Tony Nik's really depends on what you're looking for when you got out for a cocktail. If you're looking for a really sweet or highly entertaining (Tom Cruise in Cocktail-esque) bartender to make you fancy blended drinks, then this is NOT the place.  If you are looking to be considered for or to find  "The Bachelor" San Francisco male or female, once again, this is probably not the place. If you are looking for an eclectic sampling or North Beach residents (and yes we tend to at times be loud and drunk) and some tourists who are often unwisely referred to the place as another SF "attraction",  or a kick back place to hang with friends you bring with you, then Tony Nik's will be right up your alley!

PEEU8v2oWwp7OcMRFcx_gg.review_text: Great spot to have a few drinks, and hang out with a few close friends. The size is just perfect for an intimate meeting, or a nice mellow function. Overall One of the best bar's I have been too. Would recommend to all people visiting San Francisco.

Zm3vqDcEtPxc5pxfmpJGEg.review_text: Tony Nik's holds a special; place for me. It's the first place i ever went. Back in 1966, on the way home from the hospital, my parents stopped by here to show me off to all their friends. It was a regular stopping place all through my youth and the site of my first legal drink 21 years later. Butch walked (later shuffled) the boards behind the bar for nearly 40 years of my life. The place was where the old school SF sportos would bullshit. He poured a short, stiff drink and could make a pot of coffee last a week.  He was an old school, cash on the bar SF bartender.  I think Butch would like the new Tony Nik's. He'd hate the music and the frou frou drinks and probably wouldn't understand what the hell people were talking about, but he'd like seeing his bar full of happy people having a good time. I feel just as comfortable there as I always have.

nCYcZqc1S2q-8_NvL2Lrww.review_text: Very cool place.  Hip decor, but crowd is not over hip.  You know - it is still a chill place to hang and have a conversation with friends.  People watching/laughing is still good though! (And being watched is also good fun!)  Oh, and the fact that the music selection this evening was serious 80's flashback; which is all good!  As the bartender said, the music makes him (and us!!!) still feel cool!  Great drinks!  First round before dinner included a lovely dirty martini.  After dinner round was bubbly.  Generally I am very hesitant to order wine, let alone sparkling wine at a "bar."  These folks gots it going on though -- choice between Mumm Brut and Perrier Jouet Brut.  Ok, as if there is a choice???  (PJ, btw!)

CsOAZNAD-jMG3P0TpSEepw.review_text: Great old school style bar. Great lighting and an eclectic mix of patrons. The bar tenders are courteous and capable.   I love the neon sign.

eVzwz3TIVuXWZ7uum7kZRA.review_text: This place is super cute.  The front looks somewhat art-deco, but the interior brings a cozy and friendly feeling to this place.  The bartender's are friendly and the patrons approachable.  Love the different selection  specialty cocktails! I shall return!

lLGKo_ILd9kk2VP8dzs0NQ.review_text: The bartender charged me twice for the same drink. I protested. He was first insistent, and then rude. I coughed up, and then spilled my 10 dollar guinness all over myself when I tried to drink it. It's hard to drink beer when your jaw is on the floor.

w6SaPljfM2KfW9guNXCkGA.review_text: One of my favorite bars in North Beach.  We always find ourselves stopping by for a pre-dinner cocktail or for a nightcap before heading to bed when we have been out.    I love the dim lighting, the low-key lounge atmosphere, and the fact that I can usually grab a seat with my friends.  Such a great break from the Maggie McGarrys, etc. that this neighborhood tends to be known for.

wVpwTZ0ynSgHWn_tgzx2vg.review_text: Ok scratch that.  I think I came on a fluke night.  I've been loving this place lately!  ****** Honestly, I really really like Tony Nik's; I think it is a great neighborhood bar.  However, I think people who get into a fight, break a bottle, threaten other people with the broken shards, and knock over a bunch of girls like bowling pins should not be allowed to stay in the bar and continue drinking.  Last time I checked, North Beach seems to be the land of bouncers and cover charges. This particular bouncer/doorman was standing watching this whole event and didn't do anything about it.  He didn't even kick the people out.  Just goes to show you, if something goes wrong here you're on your own!

4-el2XeaLCVp1wFMhSk5yQ.review_text: Whatever happens in Tony Nik's, stays in Tony Nik's.  We live a block away, so this has become an extension of my living room. I go there with my husband, I go there without my husband. My husband goes there without me. Or with me. Or we go with friends. If there would be any other way of going there, we would do that too.  Sebastian is the best, and the rest of the guys are true stars too.  PS: This bar proved to be the best thing that could have happened to me the time my mother-in-law came to stay with us for a few weeks.

xnSJan6KlGGEbhCKqtWhCA.review_text: Check out Tony Nik's on a Sunday night when Spike's working:  only a handful of people will be hanging out (as long as there are no festivals going on), and Spike knows how to pour a stiff one.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: This is a great hidden gem in North Beach if you are going out and about for a good night in North Beach. The bartenders are very talented and mix up some of the best and potent drinks you can find...

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: The last hit of the bar hopping birthday night. The bartenders there are so cute and SO nice. We didn't know what we wanted as we were already a little buzzed. The bartender made us some awesome cocktails. The crowd is laid back and good looking at times. Def a place I would have never thought to go into while sober as the outside seemed a little hit or miss. But after this experience I'll def come back again!

-Gc-c7pzR1GK9JRVNV-4WQ.review_text: My favorite North Beach bar. Especially for a cheap, friendly post-work drink on a weekday. Great service, friendly crowd, a few tables sprinkled here and there. Just a small little laid-back locals place.

CRLA264qZO-IxB2gQOnJmg.review_text: Don't come to this place!  I'd like a seat at the bar the next time I go there and would prefer that it's not too crowded.  :)  I'm an uprooted native San Franciscan without a "spot" by design.  I like variety and don't commit to favorites.  I'll admit - this place and its personable bartenders are lovely.  Yes, Sebastian and Devon, you rock!  :) STRONG drinks if I stray from champagne.  Good Lordie.  Other reviews were ironic.  Old men, cougars,or a young crowd, fancy decor or old school, none of that matters to me if you're with good company.  My cousin and I enjoyed it because there's not a college crowd with pickled kids(no offense Savoys).  Plus, great music is low enough & doesn't compete with your conversation. That's always appreciated.  It's a far classier version of Gino and Carlo's (I lie,  it's nothing like G & C) But it is void of 20-somethings who can't handle their liquor.  :)  here's to being a straight shooter, even though I don't do shots. Cheers anyway

c77e9_8PenZ_7aBX82NszQ.review_text: I have always loved this bar - my favorite in NB.  Have come here many times, most recently during the NB festival.  Given the lay out, it is very difficult to get in and out of when the crowds are out like during festivals, or Halloween, or St.Patty's, etc.  It can also get really hot.  But, the drinks are good, the staff is always nice, and I always like the music they play.  The crowd is generally older than the typical NB bar, which I appreciate.

Xorep_PXj9XQH3UVquaZAA.review_text: Started going here years ago. Came across it while walking around North Beach trying to find something to do. Very small and narrow bar but so cute! The bartenders are always very nice and accomodating. The crowd is much older during the day and fairly young and hip in the evening. Great place for a first date, since there are a few tables in the back. This is a place that you have to go to if you live in San Francisco, it's been around forever.

ZBLZIOrO3DZJzDFlFO-bJw.review_text: A great little bar. I definitely recommend the back area with the couches and tables.   The bar is nice too but it's a great place to go on the weekday and talk to your friends without worrying about sketchy guys or insanely loud music.   The drinks are moderately priced which is always great in this city.

qethMNVnmuHd1I4on52Hhw.review_text: Best damn bar in North Beach, possibly north of Market street! No shit! Brought some out-of-towner friends here and they LOVED it! Such a great spot!

GawyLibaMGt3PCsv-hI5sA.review_text: There are very few places that have charm.  This place is one of them.   80's music, clean, cheap drinks, liars dice, locals, romantic chill booths in the back....who could ask for more? Great place to catch up over get drinks on a weekday.

yKXR-bZkkVQJsXdqwCzBrQ.review_text: I think I may enjoy this bar if I were a male in my mid-to-late thirties. Mood lighting does not reflect the clientele. Not recommended for those born after 1978.

CSXx5oez4TNYCdtdjb73dg.review_text: I agree with other yelpers that this is a great neighborhood bar. The bartenders are nice and friendly and they make great drinks! Good for groups, just a night cap after dinner or even in the middle of the week when no one is there...I love it! :)

OpfF7dqorD1lzYb3Jm0Stw.review_text: My friend turned me onto this little gem and have since made it a destination whenever I happen to be in town. Bartenders are very friendly and speaking for myself I haven't been disappointed with any drink I've ordered.  The place itself is spotless and has a definite 60's retro feel to it that love. Great place to meet up and unwind after a long day or even a meeting place before heading out for a night on the town.

4T2uVlRjkl0eogswfL2bTA.review_text: Chill, laid back classy bar! Great place to have a drink and a decent conversation!  You would not be able to tell from the outside, but this is a very well maintained bar on the inside. There is a long bar at the front and a few candle-lit tables and lounge seating  in the back.    I went on a Wednesday evening and it was full but not crowded.  The bartender makes a mean cocktail and is friendly.   A cocktail will run from $8-11.

2VwNA9tTMREL1vg3iUzYGw.review_text: When the Giants won the series, Sebastian the Awesome poured orange shots for the entire bar.  Right?  Right.

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: 3 stars for the drinks, 4 stars for the vibe.   Reminds me of Bruno's because it looks ghetto and divey on the outside, but it's actually quite nice on the inside. They have a small menu of interesting cocktails, which I can't say were anywhere near the quality of a drink from Bourbon, Rickhouse, Tradition, Rye... but it's a great unpretentious alternative for cocktails in the North Beach area.  The whiskey bourbon cocktail was actually really good even though I don't usually like whiskey, and I didn't like my vodka-based drink, Halo, at all even though I usually love vodka. So give Tony Nik's a shot, and try drinks outside your comfort zone!

P-jv9v8gs5p0_hkA4o9Icw.review_text: In a neighborhood besieged by tourists and outsiders you can count on Tony Nik's to have about 80% regulars, good drinks and friendly bartenders.  Favorite place to stop in for a pop on the way home from work or before going out to dinner in the neighborhood.

Zcr90BeQ8QWV32XIqpH82A.review_text: Sweet neighborhood bar.   I wish I lived in this neighborhood just so I could have a martini here every night.  But I don't.  Which is probably good.  So I have to make do finding excuses to be in North Beach.    But yes, great martinis.  Great mixed drinks.  Great vibe.   And great bartenders.   A solid spot if you are around.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: Terrific neighborhood NB bar, with some cozy seating in back if you can get it. When I walked in last night, I defintely felt that I was not a regular, and I like that!

SAoqvjcmfvDXhXeFLtI-zg.review_text: Excellent service. Within 15 seconds of sitting down, I had my order taken and the drink was top notch despite minimal direction. Highly recommend for a date with your love, a blind date, or some other shit. This place is fire.

7dip_D5mfhhVsLNBT0BTwg.review_text: Atmosphere is wonderful. Drinks are great. The bar tenders are fun and friendly. Owner is a great guy and very friendly. If you haven't visited this place I highly recommend making the trip, you won't be disappointed.

9vQD6duQzc6ZcWNLT44Wdw.review_text: Great place - great drinks, love the "back " section with the tables. Now, that said, it is TINY and the bathrooms are tinier.  Yes, smaller than an airplane bathroom, it's true, but really, how long do you spend inside the bathroom?

1qcq_VTO9fYIslCUwudlOA.review_text: Great dive bar.  Devon is not only a awesome bartender/mixologist but she is a great friend.  Mostly locals come here but during the weekends the place attracts everyone and all kind of folks.

lNSkba_B8yrvpEuHAi7mXw.review_text: In my top 5 SF bars.  Perfect martinis, fun ambiance, talkative (but not too talkative) bartenders with great knowledge of the city.  Two different bartenders have given me excellent dinner ideas.  I can't put into words how great this place is.  It is just something to experience.

NgGnpTgk1ZeyzMhEj3rhIQ.review_text: This place is very cool ..... its hard to label because it has several layers of vibe going on simultaneously ... kind of intimate,dark,romantic feel to it ..... yet its got an energy to it..... its small so you are going to be near your fellow patrons... its ''old-timey '' but timeless at the same time ... whoever the pampered ,privileged reviewers calling this place '' divey '' are ... they've obviously never set foot in a real dive bar . Really enjoyed this place.... cool place .... will return .

EYLy8HaGh8SzP9vZbRAFzg.review_text: Woo hoo! The heavy-handed and entertainingly surly 'tender was drunk, and after 3 sips of my cocktail, so was I!

zsHhLrbMCGs7PtIwgshasg.review_text: Tony Niks is by far my favorite cocktail den in North Beach. The bar is a throwback to an older more refined era. Most unusually this is manifested in the pure cleanliness of the place. A cleanliness most often reserved for high end hotel bars. The exterior is non-discript, the only noticeable feature being the small wall of glass bricks. Upon entering the small house of spirits you are greeted with a medium length bar on your left with a small area in the very front holding a 2 person table between the window and the curve of the bar. The table and bar comprise a full half of the space. The remaining half holds two diminutive bathrooms and a dark but comfortable lounge area. The back half is partially separated by a curved wall of glass bricks mirroring the front. The bathrooms are just large enough to house the commode and a very tiny sink. really all you need and an efficient use of space. The lounge area comprises of a few tables and very well appointed benches and chairs. Candle light is the principle source for this lounge area.      Tony Nik's is run by the grandson of the original owner. The grandson takes pride in keeping it as close to original as possible and running it with the same care and ideals as similar gin joints of the era. That said, it is the cocktails and the bartenders that are on point here, complimented by a clean and sophisticated space. Come here for classic cocktails and superior service. Tony Nik's will not be a house that involves intensive modern pretentious mixology utilizing the herbs, spices and other odd ingredients that bartenders scavenged from the kitchen thinking they are a beverage chef.      The original drinking dens are going the way of the beautiful old movies houses that once use to liberally populate the city. The Castro is the only movie house that remains, Tony Nik's may be the only quality vintage elixir purveyor to grace our fine city.

EsGeKkjMmVNU0vJLFu4Zdw.review_text: Fun bar/ lounge with strong drinks and friendly bartenders. What more could anyone want for a rowdy birthday celebration? :-)

hiNz64ErWhf7I2YtU-9dNQ.review_text: Love Tony Nik's! The bartenders are AWESOME! I always have a good time with them here. Great spot to meet a date, too.  Only downside, and absolutely not their fault, there is a douche beacon at this place. Barney's who have never gone out in their life or guys wearing suits that they assume entitle them to be womanizing pricks. It's weird. I think Amante's and Tony's have the same beacon.  Anyway, if you can avoid that, good times are to be had here and the drinks are phenomenal!!

2yATlqRKPwa4zN3LmGNfNg.review_text: North Beach has a lot of bars.  and a lot of them are full of unsavory drunks (well, they are bars afterall)....but Tony Niks is what i'd call the perfect blend of neighborhood bar and chic sophisticated bar.  it's small, quaint, romantically lit. you can sit at the bar or a couple of small tables in the back.  the bartenders are old-school cool.  they even made up the ooma-tini for me!  it's my favorite bar in north beach.

-bu-aGY_zcksvQHcOK1DlQ.review_text: After the rockin' Yelp party, I cabbed it over here to CarOline T.'s annual holiday bash. This is the first year it's been off site (not at her house), but the wine and cheese were still flowing. Well, the wine was, anyway.  I can't say TOO much about Tony Nik's since I went here for a special event, but I had a total blast. Butted heads with my old design professor, and chatted with friends as well as met some new people, too. CarOline didn't have the place totally rented out, so we also got to observe a few other interesting characters. A cool guy who looked like John Lennon, and then one guy who provided a rather unfortunate encounter....

uteMh4u9EYGK7KKOCa95ug.review_text: Love, love, love this place! It's a great, small neighborhood bar where everyone seems to know each other. Drinks are without exception delicious. I usually stick to classic drinks like manhattans, old fashioneds, and sazeracs, but there was that one night I had three dark and stormies, which were also tasty. It's also a good place to go if you want to take someone on a dimly-lit, weeknight date, or if you just want to chill with your friends. Definitely would recommend!

RFuMyqihKYlTKx8SNAjrVw.review_text: A bit of a misnomer this Tony Nik's Cafe...cuz it certainly ain't a cafe.  It's a great little bar in the front, lounge in the back, with a super nice bartender (thanks for being awesome, Sebastian), regular-feel clientele, and really easy, unpretentious vibe.  If it were in my hood I'd be there every night.  Okay, that might be overdoing it.  Not every night.  How about every Monday, Thursday, and Saturday.

H2ujzjpY1Jh3sDKgWO91_w.review_text: Not only did I love the vibe of this place (void of cheesiness, which is a plus in northbeach; chic yet unpretentious) i also got a kick out of the intense and flirty woman with the crocodile purse who, i think, was hitting on me... but when i asked her what she did for a living, she gazed at me soulfully and said "i am a mathematics editor". what? wow, i think thats my favorite pick-up line this week!

_brL8a7RCoF1QkVFMp9TcQ.review_text: I'll preface this by saying I've been to Tony Nik's before and had a great time.  Last night, however, proved to be incredibly different.  I went here after spending most of the night at a different bar in North Beach. I was throwing a going away party as I'm moving to a different city this week. The first part of the evening at Tony Nik's was fine. My friends and I found a place to sit in the back and enjoyed our beers.  I went outside with a friend to have a chat and upon coming back in, went up to the bar to order a beer.  I'm standing at the bar, I make eye contact with the male bartender and  we nod at each other. As this is happening, he calls last call.  He then comes over to me and says he just called last call therefore I wouldn't be able to get a drink.  I pleaded with him saying that I was already at the bar when he called it, that we acknowledged eachother and that I think I should be able to get a drink. He was insistent in not serving me so I proceeded to ask the other bartender (or perhaps she was the barback) if she could help me in getting a drink.  He yelled at me that I wasn't allowed to do that.  I then walked away from the bar back to my friends.    At this point, I was just ready to get out of there when the bartender comes up to me and my friends and starts yelling at me again! Telling me to go look in the mirror (whatever that means?).  Meanwhile, my friends and I are just trying to leave.  We go outside, I'm talking to the bouncer who was incredibly nice and friendly the whole night.  I'm telling him about the customer service of the bartender and how I thought it was inappropriate.  The bartender then follows me outside and starts yelling at me some more!  It was absolutely uncalled for and ridiculous.  I told him I thought he was being incredibly aggressive and that it was inappropriate.  He then proceeded to tell me that he was being "assertive" not aggressive, blah, blah, blah.    It's too bad that this bartender was such a jerk because I really liked this place and would have recommended it previously to anyone who was curious about a good spot in North Beach.  Not anymore.

XxTf-dF1lfOBgLGV-mbyfg.review_text: David is one of the very best & knowledgeable bartenders in San Francisco!  Lucky to have met him.

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: Can't say enough good things about this place! Tuesday nights rock...with a woman dj spinning some awesome classics, the ambiance is nothing short than perfect. Sebastian is a kick ass bartender and wouldn't trade him in for the world. My new local place to grab a great drink, you can chill at the tables or at the bar and still feel like you are experiencing something magical.

j0WsdZv-1fn0DD-ibNPQtQ.review_text: By far, my favorite and fabulous lounge in North Beach where the locals hang.   Sebastian manages the place and he's what make the customers keep on coming back. Besides serving a good drink, Sebastian is a good family/business man who is highly respected in San Francisco. He remembers who you are, what you like to drink and introduces you to other locals in the bar.   I definitely recommend anyone visiting from out of town or local to check this place out!

disMzAWtnDxbpL12ebrWwQ.review_text: I wrote a review on this bar in 2006 and now writing an update review.  After all these years, this is still my favorite bar in the city.  Sebastian is wonderful. I like to go in on slower nights just to talk with him and the other locals that frequent TonyNiks.

cf-J2rZQyklNDFuTEeCIMw.review_text: Solid and right in the heart of north beach. Not sure how we ended up here, I just know that we did.  Funny how bar stories always start out that way, right? Our group of 20+ crowded this skinny, narrow, functional bar.  Complete with standing bar area, sofas in the back, Dj in the front, this joint was exactly what our rowdy group needed.  Tony  Nik's is not a dive.  Clean, decent drinks, friendly staff, and 80's music on Tuesday Night.  Go figure.  Who knew I would bust a move to Michael Jackson, Rick Astley, and Prince.

9QJ-wpP36cFmiwhkeeugGw.review_text: Checked out this place when we went to SF and fell in love. Filled with locals who helped us find some new bars/restaurants to navigate artound the city. We drank here for hours and talked with the bartender. Everyone was super friendly, and the drinks were strong and good.   One main reason why I loved this place. A few guys came stumbling in and started hitting on this girl at the bar and touching her. The bartender took one look at them, and asked the girl if she knew them. She said 'No' - and he kicked them out right away in front of the entire bar. A bartender that pours good drinks, is friendly, and watches out for his patrons? I'M IN.  Wish I could come here everyday for an after work drink, but I live a little too far ;)

0nwGxhxTX_1l0zchn5PBJw.review_text: If I had a nickel for every drink I've bought at Tony Nik's I could buy some more drinks.  Hmmm. No that really doesn't capture the charm of the place.  On week days, it's about as chill and comfortable an after-work watering hole as a person could want.  The decor is nicer than one expects from an uncrowded neighborhood bar, and the vibe is much nicer than one expects from a bar with such nice decor.  Go - see for yourself, but if you bring all your Marina-Single-Wannabe-Bridge-And-Tunnel-SUV-­Driving-Douche-Bag friends, I will have to hunt you down and kill you.  P.S.  The only reason I knocked off one star is that I am almost always just a little bit cold in this place.  Brrrr.

zjcN27kCVeK8K2ONe9Qt4g.review_text: Tony Nik's is one of those neighborhood staples.  The bartenders are true professionals.  The drinks are stiff.  The clientele is classy.  Shout out to Sebastian.  Congrats on the addition to your family!  It's a long, narrow bar, and I've seen bigger bathrooms on a plane.  There is seating in the back for groups of friends, and a good number of seats at the bar.  Get there too late, and it's standing room only.  Great place for a cocktail in North Beach.

Kwz6LPHSIlHxN1SaNjiEIw.review_text: We stepped in here while we were waiting TWO HOURS for a table at the pizzeria down the street (more on that in a different review!) It looked really unprepossessing from the outside, but once we ventured in, it turned into a really beautiful bar with lovely decor and a very nice atmosphere.   I love sitting up at bars and talking to the barman - so we did just that, and I was keen to try a cocktail or two - so we did just that too! I went for one of the specials written on the board - some sort of orange citrus martini thingy. It was delicious, and the barman was extremely obliging - putting a couple of maraschino cherries in my drink because I love them! I then tried an old fashioned, and that too was delicious. They were not cheap, but man those drinks were good!  I really liked the music that they were playing - lots of recognisable, but not cheesy songs. The place seemed to be filled with grown-ups who wanted to relax and talk, and the whole experience was very pleasant.   My only complaint was that I was far too cold. The door was kept open the whole time, and 8pm in San Francisco at any time of the year is chilly... If they could sort the temperature out, this would be a fantastic place.

vqNtKMeDbIJ07RUdexsAvQ.review_text: I ended my first date with a dear old boyfriend here. We enjoyed one last cocktail and shared a sweet first kiss, ten feet from a highly inebriated girl who was taking a time-out with her face smashed against the upholstery of the couch.   New love? A cozy nap? You can have it all at Tony Nik's.

QvyzSHhufjRiUnxUVyMLPg.review_text: I LOVE TONY NIK'S!!!  Sebastian is THE MAN and this places rocks all around. Ignore Maribelle's comment about it being gay, I go there all the time and it's def. not a gay bar. North Beach is a great neighborhood and this is the best bar!  P.S. Sebastian makes the best Sidecars.

kZC7DaZpxuUL8-T1LzOtpQ.review_text: great local bar in north beach. it's quaint and the drinks are stiff. It's a great place to duck into before dinner or afterwards for night cap. It get's packed here during North Beach Festival. It has a good crowd too.

aJbXWA8OuA4mx0B67dXwNw.review_text: The only reason i'm not 5-ing this is because I'm not a fan of hard alcohol, and this is supposed to be the best place to get a mixed drink in NB. On any given sunny day it will have at least very well-dressed gentlemen slowly sipping large martini's. Any time of day, despite any festival, holiday, or nice weather.  Returned a few times recently- oh such a bar rat- and had a stellar time. The conversation doesn't start with "Where are you from?" but, more segues into whether it's Russian or Telegraph Hill. Amazing cosmos.

_eBZuZf6_ca-CwVXcFlGQQ.review_text: This place was pack the people inside kinda new each other the drinks were very strong and maybe that why this place was so crowed. I had a fun time just taking with some regular, they were telling me some story about this place the story were very interesting. Good place to have fun.

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: By far my favorite bar in North Beach.  I'd been out in NB once before, and was ready to write it off forever. So glad I didn't.   Tony Nik's is upscale and classy, almost reminiscent of a hotel bar. Yet the prices are on par with other spots in the city and the drinks are exceptionally well-made. I think I ordered the Pegu Club (?) with gin and lemon juice and some other mystery ingredient (forgive me, I was already tipsy before entering). It was sour and won my heart.  It very much felt like a neighborhood bar -- the ambiance was quiet yet welcoming, and the other patrons were friendly. Great spot for a date, or to catch up with a smaller group of friends.

_8RdsTenycwauWFXIxpEaw.review_text: Whenever I'm sitting at home on a weeknight, craving a well mixed cocktail and place for conversation where the music isn't blowing out my eardrums, I head here.  I can't really say about the weekends though, as we usually high tail it out of the neighborhood.    Oh, and Tuesday nights seem to be a special kind of magic.  Probably because the beautiful and talented Windee is spinning and the crowd she brings in is usually a great mix.     Oh yeah, and they have Bulleit Bourbon now.  Even better!

qZUgCbDYeSKnyNTSw9Ntqg.review_text: Tony Nik's is a favorite hang out for a good friend and I finally met her there on a Friday evening after 9PM.  What a delightful place!   The ambiance is mellow and very conducive to conversation.  The crowd is a nice mix of ages and styles.  And, the bartenders are just awesome!   A college friend I haven't seen in 16 years is a manager and he really enjoys his work.  So, if you're in North Beach, hit Tony Nik's up after your meal!

O8RYLkWNmZYr2HgKWsmwiQ.review_text: If you're standing in the rain in front of Tony's Pizza Napoletana and are reading this. I know a place that's warm, serves delicious cocktails and just a few short steps from Tony's where you can dry off and drink a tasty bourbon drink while you wait for your table.  Leave your cell phone number with the hostess and head over to Tony Nik's Cafe. It's the perfect place to sit and sip and discuss your pizza plan of attack. The vibe is casual and there is usually plenty of space to scoot up at the bar or just head for one of the tables and be prepared drink away.

v89VYv_SzQKzl9wFOJM9wA.review_text: What an amazing bar! Sebastian is an amazing bartender. Serving up unique drinks at great prices. Great atmosphere; cozy but super comfortable. Loved the La Paloma and the Frankfort Sour. Definitely have to check out this place.

MhVvtOGpFbJ1w-fIWB7z7w.review_text: Unexpected delight was discovered at Tony Nik's Cafe. The bartender was cool and friendly and worth talking to. The drinks were not badly priced for the area. The bathroom was small.  I loved everything I did here and everyone I talked to. Come on now, you know! Come on down and drink with your chill self.

o3vwmjnav458K41rCVgV3w.review_text: This is the definition of a neighborhood bar. Friendly customers and Great customer service.  Every time I go there I'm greeted with a big hello and always end up having a interesting chat with someone. It's just a good vibe.  And it doesn't matter whether it's Sebastian, Devon, Dave, or Darin...you are treated like a local. I've become friends with all of these people - they're just all cool and unique tenders.  And it's so funny when the negative reviews always seem to come from someone who was trying to get a beer at 2, was turned down, and tried someone else. That's why I love this place. They cater to people of all types who are respectful and filter out the rest. Best pub in SF!!!

GTdwyr4LcxJQoi1YEhPc7g.review_text: Definitely one of the best bars in North Beach.  You won't find any of the strange Broadway Street vibe at this old school bar.  The bartenders are great and so is the atmosphere.  Great place to meet up with friends or for a first date.

Fb4IkSuAmEchILfkAUswsA.review_text: Came here after I attended a roof top party almost right above this bar. I was pretty good to go and probably didn't need anymore drinks. However, we ventured to this bar/lounge and had a blast. It's not that big at all, but it's very modern and stylish inside. The bartenders were fast and courteous. The music was pretty chill and the crowd was great.   The other day, I took off from work and just went into the city. After cruising around by myself for a bit, I decided to go into this place again and see how it was when I was more sober. It was still great. There were only a few people inside and I ordered just a beer. The bartender was playing music off his iPod and it was groups such as Thievery Corporation, Nightmares on Wax and other chill groups.  I would recommend coming here with a small group of people (like 2-4) to start your night off. There's not too much room and I couldn't imagine it getting too crazy inside.

HQQ_yksK_dC8GlP_Yw7lFg.review_text: We came here because we needed to kill two hours while waiting for our table at Tony's Pizza next door. Its a pretty average bar with decent prices (especially for San Francisco). It can get a little crowded but we were lucky enough to find a table at the back of the bar. The only downside was that there was only one bartender when we ordered our drinks and he messed up our orders a couple of times.   Overall, an okay place to wait for your table!

XJhmTEAJuYRgIP4b9wMcTw.review_text: You took me here once, long ago.  We were fighting, as usual.  Your golden hair was tied up in pigtails; God you are so beautiful, even in memory.  We drank Irish coffee as the fog rolled in and the chill night swept through the city.  Dark, cream-colored lights lit up another couple, an Asian man and a tall, aging red-head, sitting at the couches in the back.  The gruff Italian bartender kept away, wiping down tumblers just out of earshot, but always kept one unobtrusive eye on our drinks.  We talked, and talked, and leaned closer and closer, and your heart melted a little bit into mine, like it used to.  When we left, we were arm-in-arm again.  You told me that you still loved me, but that it was hard, maybe too hard, and I knew it was true.  I kissed you goodnight in front of your apartment, one of the last kisses we ever had.  I miss you, every day.

z1aE5EXdEIY2MyO25NoIPQ.review_text: An old haunt of mine, back in the early 00s when I was a long-time denizen of SF. After being priced out by the boring generation of tecchies, I was forced to retreat to the Sierra Foothills hinterlands, and missed Tony Nik's. But I digress.   I returned in 2011, then again a few times this year. It hasn't changed. A relic...a beautiful relic, and thank god. Great drinks, great bartenders. Wonderful location. 4.75 stars.

NPskXw_AJuKbeNAkQE8CCg.review_text: Every time I find myself in North Beach I have to stop by this place. Dave, the bartender, is awesome. Real laid back and friendly guy. They have a great section of scotch, which is my drink. Just a chill place to relax and enjoy the time with friends.

JseBksW8DVL596kJ18GGpA.review_text: Perfect starter or last-call spot for the weekend or a great weekday chill venue. Just don't let your friend give the bartender your number; he might call it 26 times... that same night.

68IUpVhBJELMJIX8uMrw2w.review_text: Alrighty.  This is funny because I know Sebastian actually reads these.  Why I like this place:  It's right around the corner from my house, I know all the bartenders, the booze is cheap and the people are nice.  Sounds like the theme song of Cheers, doesn't it?  It's a lot more laid back than most places and the odd patterned wall will make you feel psychedelic after a while.  But it's all good and eventually you'll get stuck staring at their huge TV.  It truly is a massive TV - go look at it tell me that is not a big TV to have hang off a wall like that.  Anyway, I come here when I'm feeling spunky and I swear the people that work there have got to be saints to put up with me when I'm on one of my hyper rampages.  :o)

7CWRoP0f4TLwRkYR5syiqQ.review_text: A cool place to stop by for a drink, but it's really small so I can't imagine coming here to party at night.

5j0QmE-ktdY2wfEYX2YStA.review_text: I remember the night i got a call from J.S. ...... " Amy, there is a sexy bar is Northbeach ive not noticed before !" ( i have a term 'sexy bar' for anywhere that makes me feel sexy being in it). So one evening walking home from work i took a little peek ..... it have like velvet carpet tiles on the walls .... ooooooooooh! sexy!   So anyhow, ive been here a couple of times. Once on a 'date', it was pleasant  and second time last night after going to see 'The Bridge'. The bartender is attentive and fun, the music is decent ... rock on the 80's ! and the crowd is very mixed. There are some younger, some older , some locals , some tourists and a cool decor. The Bathroom leaves something to be desired hence this bar only getting 4 stars .. but im glad its in my neighborhood and i will definitely be going back! Rock on Tony's !

ot_DQCNw_sVkzIhjckK65g.review_text: Got roared at by bartender Sebastian as coworker from UK left $2 tip on five drinks. Not a pleasant way to treat an out of towner unfamiliar with US tipping policy. Spoilt an otherwise pleasant visit to Tony and Nik's. Sebastian - maybe you were having a bad night but that wasn't cool.

uMIVeIGgZ_gLZQV1PIk1Vg.review_text: The lounge is cozy and great for a date. Drinks were well made and the bartender left a lasting impression. Come here while you wait for Tony's pizza next door!

ZtmeHAQyNFku338dJMIfTg.review_text: This is where I take friends from other parts of the city in North Beach to prove to that North Beach is a fun 'hood with great places to go out, drink and meet cool people.    Great ambience, great drinks, great people.  Loves it!

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: This is a cool neighborhood bar.  I went for a birthday and my friend rented out the back area.  There is very little room to move therefore dancing is out of the question here.  Besides you don't want me to dance.  I will cause an earthquake.  The bartender was really nice.  He probably the owner.  I will definitely go back just to chill.

lTSe08RZhEGKTBsgG5FbNw.review_text: Alright, so I studied abroad in Sydney in college.  One of the guys who was in my group of friends while studying there - it turns out he's living in SF for three months while he hangs out with his girlfriend who lives in South SF.  He lives in North Beach, and gives me a call so we can catch up.    Now, I'm all excited and he suggests Tony Nik's.  Having never heard of it before (living in Duboce Triangle, you don't get up to North Beach that much).  So I get there, small bar, good (read: dark) lighting, only two guys in the whole bar.  Who, of course, are gay - because my Fairy Godmother is looking out for me...I haven't been to a "straight" bar in a long time, so once I do, the blow is softened by encountering some of the gays.  Phew.  So I order a drink, siddle up to the bar, and tell the patrons about who I'm about to meet.  So we're having a great old time.  Then my friend comes in and it's a great time catching up.  Then.  Well, I've considerably eased up since my college days, and I should have known that seeing an Aussie friend from college would be a drinking match waiting to happen.  Fast forward - 6 Vodka-Tonics later...all is good, but then he tries to kiss me, which is no good, no good at all.  Coincidental timing -- right about this time, the bar starts to fill up with people (and its quite small) so I take this as my cue to leave (that is, after the fat man next to me asked me to feel his behind...and oh yes, his date was next to him).    Got soaking wet waiting for a cab too.  But, I'd definitely go back - the bar was lovely.  Despite the unwanted advances.  I'll give it four stars, because there's no window to climb out of in the bathroom.

SB6ka3Rct0CqyzZawoXtAg.review_text: Great old school joint. Very laid back. Decor from the 40's but very clean and well maintained. Relaxing. Awesome and attentive bartender. Location just off of Jackson Square is perfect. Non-touristy. Well done.

8uEu5pQNnd2JiDt6YOElXA.review_text: Great NB find - we always have a good time here.  Often we go in to grab some drinks before dinner (or after Mass *gasp*) - turns into dinner!  The bartenders are great.  It's one of those bars you feel completely comfortable walking in to and plopping down on a stool even if no one is there.  It's just that inviting.  It's great to watch people walk by outside (tourists, for example) who sort of peer into the door as if it's some sketchy bar.  You just want to yell 'keep walking!!'

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: Tony Nik's is a great, chill, classy bar. The bartender there last night was SO nice (I should have gotten his name... oops!)... he humored me while I took forever to pick out a cocktail and then settled on a white russian with blueberry vodka (better with raspberry vodka I learned...).   My bf took me here after dinner on our first date and we've been back a few times since. The lighting is dim and great and I love the little candle-lit tables. The drinks are not a bargain but they are not outrageously expensive either... They have a full bar, bottled beers, and a few beers on tap (Hefeweizen, Guiness, and 2 others).   Tony Nik's is great for a date, girls' classy night, to bring parents to, etc. Enjoy!

77t-yv5_T4gmONZGwyo60w.review_text: Best bartenders in SF are here.  They also serve ice cold High Life.  TN's is great if you're looking for a chill scene - people don't come here from the East Bay to fight or get hyphy like they do on Grant Street.

ymX_IzyoQZD3E5e9nEShbw.review_text: Great little bar for locals in a sea of tourist kitsch.  Fun bar staff too.  I would give it 5 stars, but they somehow lost my debit card.

XCsZ3hWa_6oP1WkWvK7pmg.review_text: Love this bar.  This is a place you go on a Tuesday night with a couple of friends to catch up with.  It's a tiny little retro lounge and is definitely a hidden gem in North Beach.

0qvijl9gnUNKZ4YilSlsqA.review_text: I agree that this is a place for a weekday, because it is tiny and I would hate to try to get around in there if it was packed. In the back of the bar, there is a curved bench, with a few little round tables, and soft dim lighting on the dark wood paneling. It would have felt like a nice cozy place to drink a vodka and soda and chat, but for the fact that they were blasting bad 90's rock. I HATE the Goo Goo Dolls, as anyone that knows me can attest. After a bunch of Gin Blossoms, Third Eye Blind and the like, we had to get out of there. It could be a classy understated place, but playing music that loud changed the atmosphere. This isn't a bar to bring a date and talk. Even on Wedneday, the bar was pretty full by 10. It seemed like a nice mix of Marina/North Beach/Financial regular people, nothing too crazy. The crazy part was that there was a couple there, and man and a woman, that were the tallest people I've ever seen. I know women over 6' and this lady was well over 6'4. And she was wearing flats. Her date was even taller. I tried not to stare, but they were attractive as well.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: i used to live around the corner and came here quite a bit. my favorite spot was the private little tables in the back area. great atmosphere, small, cozy and laid-back. everyone in here is typically late 20's/early 30's and LOCAL which i love!  the true test was when i came here one day after a long day of paintball (i was sweaty, disheveled, wearing full army fatigues splattered with bright paint!) and no one batted an eyelash at me. go tony niks!

hSD2Lu8Z_62klnMDND5sSg.review_text: Nice...something off the beaten path.  Tiny and dark, you can actually hold a conversation with someone here, maybe even some older gent you just met (if that's what you're into), and the drinks are tasty.  P.S.  Can't go wrong with that!

VFFPgktXehQu0kfvuPjTAw.review_text: A couple years ago, Erica G. and Blake W. ushered me into the wonderful world of martinis at this bar, with grand promises of Casablanca-like coolness, the eradication of hangovers, and smooth cold deliciousness.  Had they done so anywhere else, they might not have managed to hook me, but that night, they made a believer out of me (and I think were also the impetus for me dying my hair dark brown on a dare, but that part's a bit fuzzy).  I've come back many a time since then, and whether it's for the martinis or a beer, it's still one of the best low-key spots around.

Y2n1nT_q8reJWn5dLI9jPg.review_text: Sadly I brought some out of towners tonight.  It's been a while (general aversion to North Beach) and don't ordinarily bring ousiders to the quality niches in the City.  Still don't bring just anyone to the Pig.  The interlopers, however, love the city so you can't fault them, perhaps me.  Anyone who loves walking the streets and avoids the Wharf and a cable car, except the California line, deserves a shot.  Anyway...on to the review.  Good crowd, no hassles, and stiff drinks.  What more can you ask for?  Oh yeah, no day trippers.

Ad4KI2PzWB4teJ7XEXQy3Q.review_text: This is the most awful place ever.!!! : _)  I went in there during the North Beach Festival, and the bartender ignored me in favor of hot young girls he could flirt with, and he was like 70.  Everyone loves it, but if you are a conscious, understanding, aware, and honest, person, his demeanor, over all pompous  attitude and ridiculous addiction to some old world version of reality makes a natural human sic.  Not to mention that when I spoke to the bartender he was delusional like high on cocain and still living out his mist 60s high school cool.  For all of you out there who have ethics and love, this is the wrong place.  I hope you trust me.    There's more too it, but seriously, this place is a joke, and should be flushed down the toilet wit the rest of the left over gristle.

SwczYdPhx5w2uhXSeIALLQ.review_text: This place is nice the bartender is friendly and the anti sphere with the candles on the table give the place a cozy place. The bartender can make a strong dink and you dont test the alcohol in it so watch out but have fun.

NLvNv-Au5Jldu84CubsoEw.review_text: Stopped by last week for a lil' private party here. Nothing out of the ordinary other than being a known local dive. Nice and warm from the wet weather, I enjoyed a couple of their signature cosmos over in the back couches. Though a bit narrow, there's not much room for parties of 20 and more.

hKirHL9iYVRsFlzipzfMWg.review_text: My wife and I were visiting from out of town and walked in to this place totally on advice of Yelp. We were not disappointed. Darren was a great bartender and he mixed up two nice drinks at a good price in no time.   Even on a Sunday night, It's a cool mix of a throwback casual style with hip friendly people to meet. Definitely recommended.

xraevS-47VpR23CeG-PGyQ.review_text: Loved this place. Filled with friendly locals. We drank for hours here and talked with the patrons and the bar tender. Super friendly and the drinks were great.

Ct456aEICzDfn03MHZCzsw.review_text:
So we went to hear Pink Martini and there was this d-thirty somethin stripped shirt guy all excited about hearing the band and sitting on the edge of his seat and the h-fifty somfin mama poked him and said sit back cuz she couldn't see the band and the strippee guy got all pissed and then the thirty couple and the fifty couple were gonna duke it out and then I almost laughed when the stripped shirt says "HEY, I'm Italian (jes rude Americano), don't tell me what to do" and then fifty mama says "I'm Italian too so don't tell ME what to do, call the police".
  Damn...whyz da stripped shirt getting all bunchy crunchy undyboxer fer? Cuz he's got hemmoroids or somethin?
  Anyway, we skeedadled out of that place just needing to watch more Americano Italian martini action at Tony Nik's....less fisticuffs with some older gay men at the bar. Parking is always the challenge, but the vibe at Tony Nik's was right for laughing about stripped shirt guy.

8KnhKUEcOmLlpsoBGYUdzA.review_text: I have to give this place 5 stars for the bartender, Sebastian, and for the scene itself.  The Texans who we ran into Friday night were more of a 1.5...  My boyfriend and I had just enjoyed a lovely Persian dinner down the street by Grant and Green.  We decided to stroll into TN's before going home and  we sat ourselves at the corner of the bar by an aggressive hippie who kept telling my BF to give him more space.    After a drink in, we were startled to hear the bartender barrate a trashed Texan (aged 50 years).  Apparently she had been "cut off" and so retaliated by taking sips out of every drink the bartender placed on the counter.  I have absolutely no clue why she was not thrown out.  Suffice it to say, things began to worsen.    About a drink later my beau jumped about a foot into the air.  Apparently the drunk skank had been goaded by a fellow Texan to stick her tongue in his ear.  We chose to ignore this outburst, as it was this 50-yr-olds first time in SF, but I told my beau that if i saw her do it again there would be trouble.    Sure enough, about 20 minutes later I peripherally noticed her going in for the kill.  Without even giving it a thought, I grabbed the beau's full Dewar's and soda, and with a well-timed flick of the wrist, flung it in the skank's face.    She began wailing "Oh my Gawd! oh my Gawd!"  Her friend beckoned her to the other end of the bar and cleaned her up, but this hot mess stayed on, wet hair and all, probably until well after we had left.

QHwfurIziWFY6v-_pwBGnQ.review_text: Awesome little neighborhoody bar in a hood I don't live in. Yet, I have managed to spend many a drunken evening and Tony Nik's. Cheers!

9j3EILvGpHgoOy70rIP4XA.review_text: Grace, the server I had at Rose Pistola, recommended I try out this place after I finished dinner, and I'm so glad she did (especially since I was pretty full, didn't feel like walking far, and this is just across the street).  My drink was nice and stiff, and since I sat in the back, I didn't have to deal with the crowd around the bar.  Only thing was our waitress was not the absolute friendliest (my boyfriend, who was on a fruity drink kick that night, ordered one of the cocktails on the menu, the Guava Drop, and she gave him a look and said, "Did you want that really sweet?  Or not too sweet?").  But then again, she was probably busy and didn't have the time to really socialize.

VlVx6clfF7iZfO_idvuMfA.review_text: We stopped in here for drinks while waiting for a table at Tony's down the street.  The bartender was nice, made a good drink, and did it pretty quickly.  I'm guessing this used to be an old man bar, and is now a little updated and more trendy.  A good place to have a cocktail, it definitely has more of a neighborhood feel to it, versus the tourist vibe a lot of North Beach bars and restaurants have.

IxKjgqLAG6teY_pqGnh9ZQ.review_text: One of my flatmates is a big Phoenix Sun's fan... she loves Steve Nash.  She wanted to watch the game at a bar so we decided to head out to Tony Nik's after getting a quick bite to eat.  I can never say 'no' to going to a bar and getting some beer especially with the cool roomies I live with now.  With gelato (scharffen berger and pistachio) on hand, we walked right in -- four seats available right by the bar.  Had a pint of Guinness as I enjoyed my gelato.  The bartender was really cool about us having brought gelato inside the bar, he was friendly, nice and quick.  Before I can even ask him for a glass of water, he was already giving each of of us some.  I was impressed with the service considering he was the only bartender there while more people started rolling in.    Good crowd (cute men), wonderful service, definitely a great bar!  I can't believe I've waited almost a month before checking out this bar -- it should have been one of my first stops right after I moved in North Beach a month ago.  Will be back here again for sure, perhaps to watch Giants games!  FINAL SCORE: -  Golden State Warriors (124) vs Phoenix Suns (119); -  Celeste: 5 pints of beers *  Yay Warriors ... Andris Biedrins is so cute  *

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: A cool neighborhood joint.  The place actually is a little bigger than it looks, there is a small "lounge" area all the way in the back that can be a cool spot to hang out with a bunch of friends.  This was our final stop on Fleet Week, the last bar we stopped by to buy sailors drinks.  We walked in and said hi to sailors (it's easy to spot as they are in their uniforms), offered to buy them a drink.  While waiting, we shook their hands, thanked them and asked them where they are from...it felt awesome having an opportunity to thank our servicemen.  Every single sailor we met that night was beyond appreciative of our simple gesture of buying them a drink.  Most just wanted a Bud Light, a few got something hard and quite a few declined (they said they had enough already but thanked me profusely nonetheless).    There was only one bartender working and he was beyond busy but he was quick and very friendly.  I'm not sure what and how much we ordered but the tab only came to $60 so I'm guessing the price is pretty reasonable here.    There were a few regulars, one of them thanked me for buying the sailors drinks and so I bought him a drink too!  Not sure what he ordered but he said I should try - it was licorice like, interesting.  Another couple thanked me too and said more people should be like me - appreciating and thanking our servicemen, AMEN to that!    It was a blast and I salute all servicemen!

F9tOE0d09SLkCIZwt8I-0g.review_text: Tony Nik's is proof positive that North Beach is completely different on the weekends vs. the weekdays.   On the weekends, the tourists become one with the B&T crowd, the Marina dorks, and everyone else who invades the neighborhood. It's crowded, the good restaurants have lines that are too long, and Golden Boy Pizza even fills up with the yougin' set.  On the weekdays, the regulars come back, drink their Gin and Tonics in a bar that looks new but seems to never have left the 70's, minus a new track or two on the jukebox. The bartenders seem to try to remember the regulars, which is a nightmare for most of the bars in North Beach.  The front of the bar has class -- even the regulars are slightly more formal that most of the other joints in the neighborhood. But it's understated, like a good martini.  The back of the bar is the perfect place to disappear, with it's slightly curved seating area and curtain that hides most of the area. Think dark, with a hint of bad.  It's the perfect little escape if you live here.

-z8Z93iq1b5WJpRcibdI0A.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and this is the local's spot. Go there a few times and the bartenders will make a point of knowing your name. This is what a bar should be.. service, stiff drinks and ambiance. This is the  best bar in North Beach.... that does not have necade ladies.

YYqyIgWnXT7dqPfkjl02fg.review_text: Yay! This is my favorite NB hood joint thus far. The bartenders are awesome, one even gave me some hot tea! They don't usually serve it though so don't ask.
