Drinks are amazingly cheap. Nice, laid back place, and the clientele on a scale from one to ten is like an 8 which isn't bad at all!

fD_7SxexQCKUwlG_Kc9UbQ.review_text: When you're friend is obsessed with the Godfather trilogy to the point where he randomly blurts 'fuggedaboutit' at any given time and then theme's his birthday party 'The Godfather II' (yes II), Tony Nik's is the place to be. We had a huge group and the service was excellent even as the place got crowded. eclectic mix of people as the night went on, but the drinks flowed. recommend if you happen to be in north beach and don't want to run into any d-bags as this placed seemed pleasantly d-bag free.

IxKVvGmFIEz77YYL-5_YxA.review_text: Tony Nik's may look like an old man bar from the outside, but the inside is cool and cozy. The bartenders are nice and know how to make good drinks. The bar-goers are a mix of young and old, newbies and loyal customers.   Tony Nik's is located really a few doors from Tony's the pizza place; a really convenient location when you're on the wait list for dinner.   Tony Nik's is definitely a gem.

7XbmSY6elstb685MUoAUew.review_text: This is my favorite bar in North Beach. It has a nice bar area and bench seating in the back. It's dark, but not dingy with a retro feel.  The bartenders are nice, not pretentious. Specials are written on the mirror and there's a good chance one will suit any taste. Prices are good for this area.

0gVBh57sA9nqvytKFc0eKA.review_text: Tony Niks is a gem. Old North Beach Dive Bar.. but what a delight to walk in, great feel.. its a BAR, no gimmicks, great bartender on a Saturday afternoon, filed up quickly with a FAB vib.. Thank you for keeping this North Beach Bar alive.. definitely will be on my radar for the next crawl thru North Beach.  Ciao

DvnppthwwXtQSeBAawVpzQ.review_text: Great bar! Don't spend too much time in North Beach, but I forgot how great this place is. Haven't been since 2002. It was great then, and it's just as great now. Very clean. Great decor. Great cocktail selection and good staff. It's a little off the main drag, so it's pretty much a locals spot (which is a good thing). Only negative is the bathrooms. While very clean, they're smaller than a airplane bathroom. I'm a pretty big guy, so maneuvering around to wash up afterword was an adventure.

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: A bit off the main weekend madness path with an unassuming entrance makes this spot have a more chill vibe that many other bars in the area, even when packed on a Saturday.  Bartender had good skills, style and friendly attitude.  Nice cushy bench seating at some of the tables.  Good music playing that my party all enjoyed.

y3HFVx8nbNmomSc-PWOy-g.review_text: Been coming here for years.  Something about the colors and darkness inside always reminds me of a place in Southern Cal that I used to go to years ago called Rebecca's.  That was a long time ago and believe that although the place is long gone now, their claim to fame was the lime green banquette seating there that was used in the film, Less Than Zero.  Or so I was always told.  Anyway, when the music gets a little too loud at The Saloon down the street and the crowd a little too crazy at Gino & Carlo, Tony Nik's has always been the perfect place for me to enjoy a good drink.  A nice, dark, and relaxed little establishment that I have used as my escape to bar for years, Tony Nik's is a North Beach icon.  Definitely one of the classier bars in the area in which to imbibe.  I'd forgotten how much I used to like this place.  Used to come here a lot more in the past, but somehow I moved on to the next big thing...I definitely need to come back and spend more time hanging out here in the near future.  After a drink at Gino & Carlo, this was stop number four the other night on a fun Sunday evening of barhopping in North Beach.  Just for fun, here's a list of places we hopped that evening:  Larry Flynt's (UYE) The Saloon Gino & Carlo Tony Nik's Lounge The Boardroom Bix Golden Boy  If that wasn't an eclectic drinking itinerary, I don't know what is!

Uqg8zgMw-JYJNpjVtFXqng.review_text: Tony Nik's is right where I live, so I'm here often.  This place is great. It's sophisticated, cozy, sexy and the bartenders are always nice and helpful. It's definately a neighborhood bar, which somehow filters out unwanted tourists and people from other neighborhoods and keeps it a quaint North Beach scene for the most part.

5B5LRP9x-EjJAfbhE-6FIQ.review_text: AWESOME TENTH ANNIVERSARY party Saturday.  One of the best nights I have ever had in SF and I am a native.  Mark and friends could not have done a better job.........I had two cousins in town, one from Manhattan, one from country town Oregon, and we all loved it.  THANKS and MILLE GRAZIE for your hospitality and antipasti!!!

rVA85dMsTw7B6v2opDuMuQ.review_text: My choice for a neighborhood bar in the Russian Hill / North Beach area. I came here on a Monday night, mainly while we waited for Tony's Pizza next door. It's a great place to unwind, as it's not at all crowded, with just enough people to make it feel cozy but you can use your normal conversation voice. Bartender was very laid back and made drinks meticulously. Definitely would come again

mGngqDfRtCLdW1P3j5-8xg.review_text: The only "Lounge" in North Beach worth visiting.  Sebastian is a consummate professional, and the clientele are pretty darn classy too.  Recommend!

6yyaCyUbjCAbXwpu-Piyng.review_text: Great spot for an early drink - something I'm getting into these days.  The noon-to-9 bartender made us a nice, tight Hendricks martini and had some great, lazy afternoon drinking music on his iPod hooked up to the bar speakers.  This is such a great, old bar in a fun and lowkey SF neighborhood.

2cIdR5891_TF9nEqQw-I-w.review_text: The bartenders were both very friendly and the decor is pretty charming but on a Saturday night I found the clientèle to be a little -um, how should i say.....on the "putzy" side.   nothing too offensive really, but everyone appeared to be schmoozing with a client or having drinks with an old law school chum.  (yawn).  I've got a hunch that this place would be a little more bearable on a Monday afternoon.

dhSYYwpiLurivHOXMYaoxw.review_text: Very impressed with this bar. We happened to stumble across it while waiting to eat at restaurant nearby. EVERY bartender were SUPER sociable and personable and it really made our trip.  We ended up here every night of our 3-day trip. They pour an EXCELLENT drink, and the vibe is just great. From the lighting to the music, I can't say one bad thing about this place.

H5wWPCSLao_QByZmc8rZWg.review_text: One of my stand-by spots for a friendly watering hole in my neighborhood.  The clientele is friendly, the vibe is mellow and non-touristy, and the bartenders are really cool (especially Devon!).

2RK4Xgv1zuaphxlw6YwI5Q.review_text: I met up with friends before going out to dinner at this dimly lit, cozy lounge.    I initially ordered the "Evita" cocktail because I love the combination of lime and ginger beer.  The bartender eyed me warily and poured me half a shot of straight fernet - the primary liquor in "Evita".  After I gagged down the fernet, the helpful bartender laughed and offered to make me a "Dark and Stormy" instead.  I look forward to more pre-dinner drinks at Tony Nik's when I eat out in North Beach.

0aEsYrwrBHE4LRgvv-A2yg.review_text: This place is just cool.    Why?  It looks closed but it's not.  They don't really have anything I like to drink (your basic full bar, nothing special), but cool bartenders and entertaining regulars make up for that.    Not so cool is that the bathroom is the size of a postage stamp (this did not seem to impede a couple's affection for each other, however, so be not downtrodden).   Welcome to the neighborhood hole-in-the-wall.

R2J4TqP0x7q8N4TzjqXV9g.review_text: This place is always fun.  Such an assortment of people that pass in and out, and pass out, at the Tony Nik's.  Last night saw a pretty good look-a-like for Vince Vaughn. And 6'4" no less.  He was hanging out with his friend who happened to look like Russell Crowe.  Some nights my sport becomes pointing at people and blurting out their celebrity likeness.    After entertaining ourselves on drinks and the mixture of ROMTs (Thanks Laura B for the great acronym) and Irish lads, we headed out the doors only to see Vince Vaughn smoking (so true to character).    me:  Good night Vince! Vince: What about Russell? me: Good night Russell - loved you in "The Gladiator."

-KzeNuXL9uEeg65Yzsifsg.review_text: This is a great little place, and it's the perfect spot to wait for your table to open up at Tony's. Love the throwback decor, cool bartender, and tasty cocktail specials. It has a really nice relaxed feel and the Moscow Mule is excellent.

FuVHSOP8pT8DIxkukjjaUA.review_text: Might be my favorite bar in the city. Good music and usually not too packed. Great bartenders and in my opinion the best martini in SF. Watch out for cougars!

_4ZFOXm_AXh88ZT_8YbpmQ.review_text: A great find in North Beach.  No B&T crowd at all.  The decor is sophisticated and cosy, and the bartenders are affable.  This is where you go for a well-made martini, not a drink made in a blender or that tastes like an alcohol-laced smoothie.  They make a mean Maker's Manhattan.  As a caveat emptor moment - I cannot seem to leave this bar without being over-served.  Can bartenders really be too attentive?

QcPN-Dee_dU2IWno-f2oYA.review_text: I first went to this place on my birthday in Sept 06 - didn't write a review, don't know why.  This place has now left an impression on me.  I've been there the past two nights.  The first night I was there because a man in my neighborhood found my iPod and went through hoops and ladders to find me, eventually calling Apple Care Customer Service.  He's a local in North Beach, so am I, and we sat at Tony Nik's while he explained to me just what all those hoops and ladders he went through entailed.  The bartender knew him, and I felt comfortable there.  Last night I went there later at night and hung out for a couple hours.  The crowd gets a little younger as the night moves on, and, unlike many bars in my neighborhood, this one is actually packed with people that live in the neighborhood.  It was really nice, and I appreciate places like this more and more.

AE2b_fQj55eeLc0oBMisEQ.review_text: Don't let the name fool you although not a Cafe a very nice throw back look and feel for a bar with lounge in the back for a small party or just some alone time with someone. Nice battening and well made drinks good mixture of locals and tourist with a great selection of music. Although a little small once the evening night life starts it can be a bit crowded. overall great place to sit back and relax with a great environment. Will definitely be there again

tpSWa88HEv2OgD3RZuGNqg.review_text: A very cool neighborhood bar.  Stiff drinks.  Friendly staff.  And tolerant of my antics.  If this bar was a woman, she'd be the cool but not so cute friend of the girl you want.

mBS5K_MMe_KOQzLLpOd2Jg.review_text: I love the interior, dark moody lighting with red hues and sexy smooth trip hop tunes.

BLUFWgSAlsKSwZBHiCzVUA.review_text: Great drinks and a good place to go for happy hour.  Not a huge 20-something crowd, but the bartenders make great drinks.   Sit in the back if you can!

ctr_BlCf3Ogny-vLs8E9tQ.review_text: Pros: nice-shaped small bar.  probably good for mixing and for happy hours  Cons: young male bartenders, douchy clientel,  it's in the confluence of two streets that attract marina striped-shirt assholes, transplant "locals", and B&T weekend warriors.  North Beach sucks: in case you plan to go to this bar and you don't like it, you are surrounded by other bad options.  You'll have to take the bus or a cab or walk to the Geary corridor or to the Financial District or to the hipster Mission bars.  Otherwise you're stuck in North Beach, which is, let's face it, a shadow of it's former self.  Drink elsewhere.

0AlnetQ_-a4f7kY0Sker2w.review_text: If by "Cafe" you mean "Shot Gun Bar".    And by "Shot Gun Bar" I mean "My Favorite Shot Gun Bar".    Great bar tenders who are friendly, knowledgeable, and make really great drinks.  No frills or thrills.  A few specialty cocktails written on the mirror that are always good too.  But I'd say this is one of those spots for the bar lover who knows their drink and wants it made well.   Always clean. Always warm and cozy.  Always friendly.  In the spirit of the phrase "A man's man", Tony Nik's Cafe is North Beach's "A Bar's Bar."  There are the regulars and the pre-partiers.  The bachelors and the business men.  Girls meeting up for GNO and all manner of couples.   Just note, they have the worlds smallest bathrooms.  It's actually quite extraordinary how small they are.

1ljLfQwW9E0M3zv6kW0Pmg.review_text: This bartender named Darren is great.  Get a drink from him!  Awesome mixologist!

mF3kBOQEHeTkd51W3D4ZjQ.review_text: Tony, Nick, Danny, Mark, Chad and Biff... wow, when I arrived at 10:00 pm on Sat night the place was a total sausage fest.  I came for drinks with the bf so I wasn't trying to check out the talent or competition, but apart from the waitress I was the only female in there.  My bf also took the time, as only he could,  to comment on the unusual lack of "gash" in the bar. However, in another hour or so the ratios were fairly even.  I loved the bar: laid-back, friendly service, good lighting and fun cushy seats in the back.  BYOB (bring your own babe) for an even better time.

Vquexp-WD-k5mxPZmS2IzA.review_text: One of SF's gems! Not only are the cocktails fabulous but Sebastian is also a fantastic bartender! Have been coming here for years and plan on continuing to do so!

skjkxo7Ewz3cbxW4TQNK5g.review_text: Great bar - has the absolute feel of a good 'ole neighborhood joint.  Met up with a friend for a few martinis - why is it that you can't ever stop with 1 martini??  Oh wait, maybe that's just me ... Never mind!  Super friendly bartender.  How can I not be completely enamored with a bar in which the bartender thought me to be 26 ... Love. Love. Love.  North Beach can be disastrous to find parking pretty much any time of day - any day of the week.  Thankfully, the restaurant next door has valet and they are more than happy to take your $10 to valet your car.  How happy was I that when the valet was ready to close, one of the guys parked my car on the street for me and came into the bar and brought me my keys.    Fabulous!  P.S. They serve Hangar One ... Woop Woop!

VeJxI6D5SMRuX8_0RYT1TQ.review_text: This subtle & unassuming bar has a reputation among "my inner beings" for seducing me once I enter. After I get past the no-nonsense bouncer, the bartender always manages to free me of my inhibitions w/ only the magic of his pour.  Transformed, I am then sent out into SF's ambient North Beach, where intelligent hotties are just freely walking up & down the street (FREELY, just available & FREE) like, like, like...                                                       (still agape)  ...like Adonis-built co-eds looking for good times. Wait--Many of the guys in NoBe *are* co-eds looking for a good--Nm.  All's I know is that, when the sun comes up, the last thing I usually remember was being at Tony Nik's, so I guess that's a ((good)) thing. ?O_O?

KCaOZUnCx25FJhFr_lKsEg.review_text: I love this place. It'd been a long time since I'd been in, but had an opportunity to down a few drinks here this month during SantaCon.  Firstly, service was very quick even though they were overrun with Santas. Friendly, too.  Prices are pretty fair, especially compared to other bars in the immediate vicinity.  I was drinking double call drinks and I think they were around $8.  Strong pours. I needn't have been drinking doubles, really...  The jukebox: I think I remarked on the jukebox during *every song*.  It is fantastic.  There is quite a bit of seating even though it's a small and narrow space.  Only con to the layout are that the bar can get really crowded when they're busy since there is not a lot of spare room for people entering and exiting the bar.   I left wondering why I hadn't been back here in so long... "I'll be back."

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: Tony Nik's is a dope spot to kill time whilst waiting to dine at overrated restaurants that aren't worth your money. I'm talking one and a half hours here honey and it ain't right to keep me stahhhhvin that long.   Tony Nik's to the rescue!! 3 cocktails, a gin + tonic and a Jameson coke for only $40? WHOA. I must be totally used to douchebag bar/lounge prices because that seemed so cheap to me.   Bartender is a super sweetheart. The brunette one.. I didn't catch her name (sorry) but thanks for carding me! I love it (Thank you Asian genes). She was super nice too and made great recommendations to my friends on the cocktails.   If I was in this area again, I'd definitely hit up Tony Nik's. It is very small but if you're only here with a small number of people, you should be fine.  Oh, and they're totally cool about you eating pizza from next door in here.

sqOhvHPiwvSVVFPCJLrfuw.review_text: I went here last night to unwind a bit and the place did not disappoint. I had a Guatemala Limonade or something (a rum drink), and it was well made. I followed up with a Manhattan which was also expertly made. What I liked is that the bartender  asked me what kind of gin I wanted, and gave me some options. I said I wanted some olives in it because that's how I roll, and he said that Hendricks would not be a good option because Hendricks has cucumber flavor or somesuch. He recommended Plymouth and it turned out well.   What I liked is that he did not talk down on me, he was just a friendly guy. He came by to check up on us periodically but was not pushy.   Drinks are OK priced, not too cheap, not mind-blowingly expensive.   We were lucky to score two bar seats towards the end of the bar, but I saw a lot of people standing around.   The music was nice in that it was not overbearing. ESPN was on the TV but thankfully the sound wasn't on.

QbddwvhELG9-loCCV16U8w.review_text: Never a bad time at Tony Nik's!  Great drinks, fun peeps, awesome bartender.  Frankbastian (aka Sebastian) does up your drinks right!  Don't hang in North Beach much, but when I do, this is a must-stop.

1eFJXbzad-ye0heUyI-1Qw.review_text: This place had a much better atmosphere when it was more of a  neighborhood bar.  Gotten really crowded as of late.  I know it's not a really a bad thing.    Quick tips, go straight to the back of the bar and grab one of the tables or try to grab the nook up front.   You can usually find one open.   The staff has always been friendly and professional.

oAz4s21FA2QjE0kCNIDxOg.review_text: Tony Nik's is a classic San Francisco bar, which has been in business since the 1930's. The owner is actually the grandson of the original owner...how cool is that? Tony Nik's has a retro feel, they make great drinks, the bartenders are attentive and friendly, and there's always a cool, diverse crowd. If you're looking for a bar in North Beach, this should be your #1 destination.

RySDpRT0wC1xTkq5worldA.review_text: Love this joint and the way they love, ok more like DEAL with me and my rambunctious friends.  Always run into a friend or make a fun friend or two here.    It feels like home.  That is all.

d2Xa7nTMzPoGWDRyr2QinA.review_text: Drinks are expensive, and there's an implicit dress code, but it's not as pretentious as you might think when you first enter. Pretty friendly, and definitely a laid back lounge vibe. But there's not much room to lounge in... the place is packed like a hallway. Overall, mediocre.   You probably won't get in under 21.

0gEDwhSUIWIBz23MbLYMig.review_text: A retro chic oasis in the chaos that is North Beach.  It's a great place to get away from the *loose off the goose* titty shirt wearing twits and chodes that flood the area.  The bartenders are very nice and make great drinks as well.  They do have the smallest bathrooms ever though.

HSBYcqcnkzrBlQ9Z1V_bQQ.review_text: My favorite bar in North Beach and I have been coming for years.  It is everything that a neighborhood bar should be---1)  friendly bartenders (sebastian and darren)  2) affordable prices  3) chill atmosphere without it been pretentious or rundown  4) neighborhood crowd  5) great drinks.  This is an adult bar, where people come to hang out with friends, or just random people at the bar.  The best thing about Tony Nik's is that it is not trying hard to be anything pretentious or flashy, or hip....just a normal bar, with normal cool people

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: i like the vibe here; very low=key. usually locals only. it's not flashy, but it's nice

J5J0v-WShT2NwhTRIM5SnQ.review_text: 2.5 but a 3.0 because I'm feeling generous. If I rated places on looks I would give it a 4. But nothing real special going on here. I asked the bartender for a good IPA and he looked at me like a deer in the headlights.  Am I a beer snob? Yes! Should a bartender know what a good IPA is?...Yes! Especially if it's on the tap. Which it was. Maybe I shouldn't rate this place because of their lack of beer selection.  He asked me "how was it because I've never had it?"........Ehhhhh no bueno! Decided to try a cocktail on the menu and it was way too sweet.... Kind or lame. The bathroom is pathetic. Extremely small.....take a piss, wash my hands, take a deuce and while I have someone watch me ALL at the same time. I felt bad for the group that was sitting at the table just a few feet from the door.....enough said.  Overall.......meh.

0u5JfFEbkHwqWUOQtewU8Q.review_text: Love this place. Great cocktails, a fun crowd and the bartenders are always a great time.

_WDhO6yeZQoVo5agXH3Tbw.review_text: Wow, people should not judge this place by the sign!  I came here with my boyfriend and some friends for some drinks after dinner.  As soon as we walked in, I noticed a nice bar near the walkway.  There were a few tables and chairs for customers to enjoy their drinks.  We all decided to sit at the tables near the back of the cafe.  I liked how there are tiny candles on each table.  It was definitely a dim and  romantic setting. =)  This bar also plays music kind of loud, so it feels like a club..lol.  Since I read a lot of great things about the 'lemon drops', my boyfriend wanted to try it for his birthday.  One of my friends got him the lemon drop, and he loved it!  The drink was placed in a nice martini glass with a slice of lemon on the side. (See picture)  I decided to buy my boyfriend a drink for his birthday.  He told me that he wanted a 'rum with coke'.  I walked up to the bartender and ordered it.  When the bartender asked me 'what type of rum?', I was a bit confused..lol.  Since I actually don't drink, I went back to my boyfriend to ask him what kind of rum..lol.  After asking all my friends and boyfriend for the rum type, they told me to get 'Captain Morgan'.   I walked back to the bartender and said 'Captain Morgan!'. =)  The bartender asked if I wanted lime.  Again, I was confused..lol.  The bartender was nice enough to put it on the side, so I didn't have to go back to my boyfriend to ask.  The rum & coke cost $6, and my boyfriend enjoyed it.    I noticed at around 10pm, the bar got really packed and super loud.  Since we couldn't really hear ourselves talking, we decided to leave.  Overall, this is definitely a great bar!

Pb_vpXkhbAqf8w4jdrEixw.review_text: Had the best first date of my life here!!! I'm new to SF and love bars that exude good energy that one is incapable of explaining with words why it's sooo good. I'll do my best to recollect. Solid drinks (pun intended), good lighting, great energy= best bar in NB! You can chill at the bar and talk it up with the cool tenders or sit intimately in the back. Thanks Tony Nik's!!!

3hjeA6vwna_Cbm2TXV_klw.review_text: Strong drinks for strong drinkers.  IN.

yN3cBeSdhtFRcFPdLgDlbw.review_text: A great bar, which I thought I hadn't been to before. However, I recalled as I walked in that I had in fact, been to Tony Nik's. Only at that time I was rather drunk from pub crawling with my girlfriends during the NB pubcrawl.  Eeks!  But I did remember the bartender as he was super cool and friendly and made great drinks. And being a girl on my own until my guest arrived, I didn't feel weirded out, rather I felt comfortable.  Wednesday night was a good night to go. It was full, but not packed and never was loud to the point where I was shouting to my date.  Small, but a nice feel to it with simple decor and rocking music!!!!  The bathrooms were teeny and reminded me of airplane lavatories, but it may allow you to recreate any mile high club moments ;-)  Definitely will hit this place up again when I am in the neighborhood!

HaqL5KNW5bqCwTX7Y8pigQ.review_text: I love this local bar. Nice people, and almost always space to sit in the back.

s9NEYc4yqroMs5DTM3PSJg.review_text: Awesome bartenders make this place a true gem of the neighborhood! We were visiting from NY for the weekend, and loved this place so much that we went back twice! Bartenders are SUPER friendly and will cater to your liking like mad scientists! Just tell them what you like and they will concoct elixirs for your pleasure! Drinks are about $10-$14, but well worth it.  If you don't like something, they will change it. Have fun and try the pizza next door too!

H06yvBfzMSK6VKvKl_PbhA.review_text: Great drinks, relaxed atmosphere, friendly bartenders, and a great location.  What's not to like?  This is not a place filled with young, loud, fratty bros, which adds considerably to its appeal.  It's not very big, but its rarely that crowded.  Seating in the back makes for a comfortable evening.

4W1D-dUW7bC_CJYgslzUqA.review_text: This is a terrific place to get a drink. Good drinks, good service, decent place to sit. A little small, so don't come with a large group.

JsVB8eE-FOhJjf5hL0nNwQ.review_text: No complaints here! Bartender nice and attentive. Very cute setup, with plenty of seating in the back. Yummy pomegranate martinis.

qhp9MmceD-7NzVBeM1TWlg.review_text: great place to start a weekend in sf. i always walk down from my hotel on the hill for happy hour. not many people there at the time but a great first stop to get acclimated to the city. nice people at the bar. citysearch always rates it as a singles place, don't really get that, but then i'm in the mission by prime time.

YFpIbSmPxZK5LWjWnf_INg.review_text: My friends and I  love watching Sat/Sun games at this spot because the atmosphere is always so absolute cool... Although I ended up doing the 'exact' opposite of what I'd planned for the day, I had one of the most enjoyable Super Bowl viewings I can remember watching the game at T-Nik's.  I sincerely LOVE  this place and the people that work and reside here for so many many reasons.  Now there's one more! Tony Nik's is simply the Best of the Best...!

JEHAIJ0dhJZTVo90BxA6iA.review_text: nice pours, bachelor pad decor, doting service.  great place to stop for a couple of drinks before or after whatever else it is that you do.  say hi to Seb por moi.  .n.

ZOekkGdVJT5LjGSARoORQQ.review_text: I struggled between 4 and 5 stars for Tony Nik's. I'll have to go with 4, only because I didn't get a chance to interact with the bartenders since my friends did all the ordering. I hope to chat them up next time and hopefully update my review.  Came in on a Saturday night with two of my friends. With an unassuming entrance in the middle of North Beach, the bar looks like a dive from the outside. It's quite the contrary.  Inside, the decor is clean, classy and clearly modern. It's longer than it is wide. The actual bar lines the left side as you walk in; there are small tables in the back with some booth seating.  Again, my friends ordered so I can't comment on the bartenders. However, they do make some great classic drinks! We ordered the following: old fashioned, martini, negroni, gin and tonic, and a whiskey on the rocks. All of them were very good. My negroni was craftily blended, smooth and strong.  The general atmosphere is pleasant, especially when you consider it's in the middle of a rowdy district. It's laid-back, and both the older and younger crowds seem to coexist peacefully. Scattered throughout are couples/two person groups and larger parties. Everyone seemed to be having a good time. They keep the music at a decent volume that still allows for great conversation.  This place has the thinnest bathrooms I've ever seen! There's one per gender. There actually ended up being a line for the men's while we were there, which I thought was unusual.  It never got too crowded (although we didn't stay super late). There was always room in the back. I think my friends and I had a fantastic time - and I expect to return often.

OBZWID2s7E9c0pIkNqD1Ng.review_text: UPDATE for 6/16/2011 Oh, Tony Nik's... you still know how to be the best there is. The Girlfriend and I stopped in last night for a few rounds of yummie libations, and though there were a bunch of people in the place, we still found a quiet table to hang out at. The nice thing about TN's is that, for the most part, the only loud noise - during the week, anyway, from what I have experienced - is from people talking. They have music playing in the background, yes, but this is one of the few places that I have found which doesn't THUMPTHUMPTHUMP you out of the bar with your ears bleeding from the loud music at the end of the night. This place is more for those who actually want to talk to each other... isn't that just cool?! :)  We love ya, Tony Nik's! --------------   Possibly one of the friendliest and best places I have ever been. Tony Nik's is a cozy, friendly, down to earth, and all around nice place to go to relax on a weekday after work. This is the way a bar should be... good people, great drinks, comfortable to the point where even if you've never been there before, smile and say hi to the bartender and to those around you, and you'll fit in well. The only time I was there and didn't stay for a drink was on a Saturday night... I was with a group of about 8 friends and we stopped in for a drink around 9:30... the place was PACKED. I think there was a private party in the back, and the bar area in front was tight standing room only. We were sad that we couldn't find room to stay and enjoy the place, but no worries... we're going back again soon. Earlier, this time. :)  All in all though, I would recommend this place to anyone... but it's also one of the places where I'd like to keep it to myself as well, because it is such a nice place. ;)

7-3hVAMj42uAyc3oiVIlQA.review_text: Local watering hole - a mere few blocks from my comfy abode.  As other lovely Yelpers have said, great drinks and really friendly bartenders. David rocks; he listened to me blathering on and on and was just so nice about it (my date didn't seem thrilled, however).    (Btw, they don't have my fave Scotch - Bruichladdich.  I still love them though.)

b5xky1NsvoaUK4ScJT695g.review_text: My favorite neighborhood bar.  Always a great vibe, good martinis and a good crowd.  It is rarely to loud or crazy.  And the bartenders are very friendly.  Although I sometimes wish it weren't so damned convenient...

fJo2X5zfzLFJl6hrJzalTg.review_text: A hidden gem in North Beach.   The plan was stop in with my wife for only one drink before dinner. Yeah, that didn't happen. After chatting with one of the nicest bartenders ever, we ended up staying there for over two hours; sipping on martinis and chatting it up with a great crowd. The music was fantastic (soul, chill, funk, rap) and the drinks were extremely good. What made it the best place ever was finding out from the new bartender (yeah we were there that long apparently) that our previous bartender (and new best friend) paid for our first round.   Highly recommend stopping in for a pre-dinner cocktail.

hEvVSgnTqEyLurpAzt1gFQ.review_text: Excellent. Great place to chill and drink. Left my phone but they took care of me when I returned later even tho I'm pretty sure they were ready to go home. It was closed... Thank you Tony for being authentic and nice to an inebriated tourist.

lGUIeB1MDqNfXsukqvo3qg.review_text: The Nik deserves 5 stars specifically for its collection of locals, old and young, who pretty much just want to relax and have some damn drinks.

9mr1YgKEKOD0Si4v46nqNA.review_text: Chill, good crowd, just dark enough, cozy tables in back, great bartenders, straightforward drinks....  Gotta love Tony Nik's.

lLptGOYUfQ-Ir47UYJv0dw.review_text: Tony Niks is a mix of both classy and eclectic. The vibe of the bar is a 1960's feel. Tony Niks is a local bar where one can step away from the tourist infested North Beach area. The bartenders are laid back, relaxed and attentive. They love their jobs, and I could tell that they have been there for awhile!   This is a no frills and thrills bar. Not for the Marina crowd. I usually come here for a neat pour of Whiskey, which is fair and reasonably priced compared to the rest of the city at $7. Also the beer and shot combo is $11. They also offer a selection of crafty cocktails, for groups of people with different tastes for alcohol. It's a great  hangout before or after dinner. It is never crowded, and always welcoming.

oavPd3eVwL0N8Y4t3WvrBw.review_text: Not the best place to go meet people, but a pretty nice place to have a drink on a weekday night, have weekend glass of scotch or strong manhattan, or just stop off between neighborhood bars.  The decor is awesome and you will usually only find SF locals if you like that sort of thing (i do)

kCAy6d5idvVGU6boSzlGqg.review_text: Awesome customer service...good bartender...good drinks...and awesome little atmosphere with nice classical music...tv for sports...crowds of all types. Fun place

e77JyltArqckcdBl13bVbA.review_text: Great neighborhood bar.  Bartenders are great: Sebastian and Devon.  DJ Windee on Tuesday nights.  Good mood lighting inside.  What else do you need?

To7EBxWC-Yz011V2-tdTvA.review_text: Actual conversation had by Laura B., Joy M. and two Random Older Mob Types (ROMT) at this fantastic throw back to old school North Beach which I imagine was vastly superior to the current super cheese-ball incarnation.  One of the only reasons I travel to this part of town.  Simply fantastic.:  Seating arrangement is as such:  ROMT #1, ROMT #2, LAURA B., JOY M.  ROMT #2: What are you lovely ladies doing here?  LAURA B: Having a drink.  ROMT #1: What are you ladies having?  We tell them, get a free round, thank them, it's delightful.  ROMT #2 to Laura B.:  nice ring...you engaged?  HE POINTS TO A LARGE FAKE DIAMOND AND FAKE RUBY RING IN THE LIKENESS OF HELLO "MOTHERFUCKING" KITTY THAT WAS PURCHASED IN NYC CHINA TOWN.  Joy M.: YES.  She is engaged to be married.  That is her ring.  Laura B.: What can I say?  He loves me.  And scene.

H5tU70rJCqCES1FBCz8-NA.review_text: Good bar. North Beach Bridge and Tunnel meatheads tend to miss this when they're trawling for tuna, so they crowd is more 'neighborhood' than 'tourist,' which is extremely rare for NB. The decor is 'lived in' while remaining 'stylish' - also a rare treat for a bar in North Beach. The bartenders are pros and I'm an alcoholic, so it's a match made in heaven.  Now that I think about it, this place sucks and you'll hate it. Whatever you do, don't drink here.

WM2s8we7jLU4p4650dvIWA.review_text: "When you see the sign, you won't want to come in. Keeps the wrong crowd out & the right one in."   True, true, true, feels like you've dropped onto a Mad Men set unexpectedly in North Beach (with some retro, 70's artifacts still kicking about). A stiff drink, some sweet tunes, & charming banter. Head over on Mondays for Victor.  "Where everybody knows your name, and they're always glad you came." And you'll be, too.
